commit_message:
Replace upgrades template when providers run again

The upgrades template was commented out to get
a change through that fixed failing content providers.

This template can be added back when the two
relevant release content provider jobs are
passing again.

Change-Id: I8508e7609858cd3511ba659f3bb8ab02eeb476f2

[{'created': '2021-08-16 12:11:42.000000000', 'message': "Fix missing ssh key in scenario010 job

A recent commit in THT introduced basic support for Octavia ssh key
generation in tripleo-ansible, and it modified the scenario010 job
parameters in order to use this new method. But as the related
tripleo-ansible commit
(https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/783824) hasn't
been merged yet, job is broken. This commit restores the previous
parameter which uses the current user's ssh key.

Change-Id: I6c100f9f0d57806388489806f0493cc78525de20
"}]
commit_message:
Fix missing ssh key in scenario010 job

A recent commit in THT introduced basic support for Octavia ssh key
generation in tripleo-ansible, and it modified the scenario010 job
parameters in order to use this new method. But as the related
tripleo-ansible commit
(https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/783824) hasn't
been merged yet, job is broken. This commit restores the previous
parameter which uses the current user's ssh key.

Change-Id: I6c100f9f0d57806388489806f0493cc78525de20

messages:
[{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-08-12 07:56:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2021-08-12 08:47:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-08-16 08:58:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2021-08-16 14:25:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

recheck

Just in case it's a one time problem, but probably real breakage:

The following packages have unmet dependencies:
 qemu-utils : Depends: qemu-block-extra (= 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.16) but 1:4.2-3ubuntu6.17 is to be installed
              Recommends: sharutils but it is not going to be installed
E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-12 07:56:27.000000000', 'message': 'Support specifying a Kayobe environment to use

This also includes a cherry-pick of
I9a44578196086ec24de80b992fed385826778feb, Stop accessing unbound
variables.

The kayobe-env script would try accessing $1 which is an unbound
variable if no argument is passed. This fails when `set -u` is set.

Also refactor usage output into a function. As a side effect, a missing
argument to --environment now causes the script to properly exit with an
error.

Change-Id: I604c2ae6c47ef16fdc98e0598cad820e49e2ff26
Story: 2002009
Task: 41577
(cherry picked from commit 75b6402f8b0d4e39c40a1d11091ca760d8b99dee)
(cherry picked from commit f1d98a93941013e5fda5489de1629cc5e282fd07)
'}]
commit_message:
Support specifying a Kayobe environment to use

This also includes a cherry-pick of
I9a44578196086ec24de80b992fed385826778feb, Stop accessing unbound
variables.

The kayobe-env script would try accessing $1 which is an unbound
variable if no argument is passed. This fails when `set -u` is set.

Also refactor usage output into a function. As a side effect, a missing
argument to --environment now causes the script to properly exit with an
error.

Change-Id: I604c2ae6c47ef16fdc98e0598cad820e49e2ff26
Story: 2002009
Task: 41577
(cherry picked from commit 75b6402f8b0d4e39c40a1d11091ca760d8b99dee)
(cherry picked from commit f1d98a93941013e5fda5489de1629cc5e282fd07)

commit_message:
tripleo_frr: set default version and profile

Pin FRR version and profile to known, tested values.

For more detailed information, please refer to
https://docs.frrouting.org/en/latest/basic.html#configuration-versioning-profiles-and-upgrade-behavior

Change-Id: Ie09c7ed93ec38cff63abe69bf1c2b60132982cfc

commit_message:
Remove ``ConfDriver`` code

The quota driver ``ConfDriver`` was deprecated in Liberty release.

``NullQuotaDriver`` is created for testing although it could be used
in production if no quota enforcement is needed. However, because
the Quota engine is not plugable (is an extension always loaded), it
could be interesting to make it plugable as any other plugin.

This patch also creates a Quota engine driver API class that should be
used in any Quota engine driver. Currently it is used in the three
in-tree drivers implemented: ``NullQuotaDriver``, ``DbQuotaDriver``
and ``DbQuotaNoLockDriver``.

Change-Id: Ib4af80e18fac52b9f68f26c84a215415e63c2822
Closes-Bug: #1928211

commit_message:
Deprecate the ceilometer::policy class

Ceilometer removed its API service a long ago and no longer uses policy
rules. This change deprecates the invalid class to manage oslo.policy
settings.

Change-Id: Id2a7ebaf57b97083b8cc9eb32a8ecefcee39672f

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-17 18:19:07.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: Do not destroy volume secrets during _hard_reboot

Ia2007bc63ef09931ea0197cef29d6a5614ed821a unfortunately missed that
resume_state_on_host_boot calls down into _hard_reboot always removing
volume secrets rendering that change useless.

This change seeks to address this by using the destroy_secrets kwarg
introduced by I856268b371f7ba712b02189db3c927cd762a4dc3 within the
_hard_reboot method of the libvirt driver to ensure secrets are not
removed during a hard reboot.

This resolves the original issue in bug #1905701 *and* allows admins to
hard reboot a users instance when that instance has encrypted volumes
attached with secrets stored in Barbican. This latter use case being
something we can easily test within tempest unlike the compute reboot in
bug #1905701.

This change is kept small as it should ideally be backported alongside
Ia2007bc63ef09931ea0197cef29d6a5614ed821a to stable/queens. Follow up
changes on master will improve formatting, doc text and introduce
functional tests to further validate this new behaviour of hard reboot
within the libvirt driver.

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflict as I41b7c1653c6a887ee4b08e588c5d422409aebfba
isn't present on stable/train.

Conflicts:
  nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

commit_message:
libvirt: Do not destroy volume secrets during _hard_reboot

Ia2007bc63ef09931ea0197cef29d6a5614ed821a unfortunately missed that
resume_state_on_host_boot calls down into _hard_reboot always removing
volume secrets rendering that change useless.

This change seeks to address this by using the destroy_secrets kwarg
introduced by I856268b371f7ba712b02189db3c927cd762a4dc3 within the
_hard_reboot method of the libvirt driver to ensure secrets are not
removed during a hard reboot.

This resolves the original issue in bug #1905701 *and* allows admins to
hard reboot a users instance when that instance has encrypted volumes
attached with secrets stored in Barbican. This latter use case being
something we can easily test within tempest unlike the compute reboot in
bug #1905701.

This change is kept small as it should ideally be backported alongside
Ia2007bc63ef09931ea0197cef29d6a5614ed821a to stable/queens. Follow up
changes on master will improve formatting, doc text and introduce
functional tests to further validate this new behaviour of hard reboot
within the libvirt driver.

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflict as I41b7c1653c6a887ee4b08e588c5d422409aebfba
isn't present on stable/train.

Conflicts:
  nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

Closes-Bug: #1905701
Change-Id: I3d1b21ba6eb3f5eb728693197c24b4b315eef821
(cherry picked from commit 26d65fc882e42b824409dff87ff026dee1debe20)

(cherry picked from commit 7a69f9800b97606cd05068d3ad4fc6d0061a7a55)

commit_message:
virt: Add destroy_secrets kwarg to destroy and cleanup

This change adds a simple optional kwarg to the virt driver signature of
destroy and cleanup to allow for callers to control when secrets should
be removed.

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflict as Ia5892e1d2cb7c7685e104466f83df7bb00b168c0
isn't present on stable/train.

Conflicts:
  nova/virt/fake.py

Change-Id: I856268b371f7ba712b02189db3c927cd762a4dc3

commit_message:
virt: Add destroy_secrets kwarg to destroy and cleanup

This change adds a simple optional kwarg to the virt driver signature of
destroy and cleanup to allow for callers to control when secrets should
be removed.

NOTE(lyarwood): The xenapi driver cleanup and destroy methods are also
extended to take the destroy_secrets kwarg. This driver was later
removed during Victoria thus the <= stable/ussuri specific change.

Change-Id: I856268b371f7ba712b02189db3c927cd762a4dc3
(cherry picked from commit 1cc52fd2f22ec37194519e473c88260bf90a3c8c)
(cherry picked from commit f2ba67184d3801fdca4a33aa744a3471bcd21de2)
(cherry picked from commit f805779363b9933386eee4222de15466c547ba38)

commit_message:
Use the new type HostDomainOpt.

Use the new oslo.confg type HostDomainOpt to support underscore in the
name. You can see the bugzilla[1] to have more information.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1868940

Related-Bug: #1892044
Change-Id: Ib6c8fc1e3d90b79b10066c429670fcb957bddd23
(cherry picked from commit 0d84833e9688e0df97f3d24e06025e512bca3ce3)

commit_message:
Raise correct exception from "Quota full"

Swift driver reraises the client exception causing glance-api
to return 500. Lets raise g_s StoreFull correctly instead.

Change-Id: I5be151afe242a75142e74d488c4787a35929e189
Closes-bug: #1926404

commit_message:
Do not install libvirt python bindings from pip

Since [1] was merged, devstack no longer installs libvirt python
bindings from pip but use distro packages. This change removes
the logic to install the python bindings using pip to follow that
change in devstack, otherwise installation fails because of conflict
between packages available in pip and one installed by distro packages.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/798514

Conflicts:
	devstack/plugin.sh

Resolved conflicts caused by f57a51e43ca7a8903763cc24b1c510fa50a16b2c
which is not backported to stable branches.

Closes-Bug: #1939990
Related-Bug: #1933096
Change-Id: I369a95cf30e91738d10ad2e5a3d5f6988bdd76cb
(cherry picked from commit 9366bc8f18a07695aa1af9217307b0a55376a331)

[{'created': '2021-08-12 08:39:13.000000000', 'message': 'Fix up cluster_setup_extras usage

This pairs with https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/739933.

Starting with pcs 0.10 (CentOS/RHEL 8) the arguments to pcs cluster
setup changed completely in an incompatible way and in fact are ignored
by puppet-pacemaker.

This review makes sure ${cluster_setup_extras_real} is taken into account
when the cluster is set up via pcs 0.10, addressing LP#1886789.

Related-Bug: #1886789
Change-Id: I1dc3a72a51a4f816bb79986e845798d869223ffe

commit_message:
Fix up cluster_setup_extras usage

This pairs with https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/739933.

Starting with pcs 0.10 (CentOS/RHEL 8) the arguments to pcs cluster setup changed completely
in an incompatible way and in fact are ignored by puppet-pacemaker.

This review makes sure ${cluster_setup_extras_real} is taken into account when the cluster
is set up via pcs 0.10, addressing LP#1886789.

Related-Bug: #1886789
Change-Id: I1dc3a72a51a4f816bb79986e845798d869223ffe

commit_message:
Resolve compatibility with oslo.db future (redux)

Build on change I957d2a9d7c875120bed0022ce1e953b2ec9f97cd by addressing
additional issues introduced by future breaking changes in oslo.db. As
with this change, the changes stem from the table returned from
'oslo_db.utils.get_table' being no longer bound to a 'Connection' or
'Engine'.

Change-Id: Ic28bef6ad4e47a86e423a10e8479b60134cbb0a5
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1939716

commit_message:
Update playbooks to use consistent working dir

Updates the cli-enable-ssh-admin.yaml and cli-grant-local-access.yaml
ansible playbook executions to use the consistent working directory
instead of a temporary directory. Adds reproduce_command=True to the
calls to utils.run_ansible_playbook so that the workflows can be re-run
out of the deployment for reproducability.

Change-Id: Id4880be3a0d936e67bfc77ed28145eb1b9de162e
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Replace duplicate code to get klb crd path

As part of the change below, we are adding a utility code to get klb crd
path.

The klb crd shares the same namespace and the name as the service,
endpoints.

This code can be hence re-used for services too.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/+/804205
Change-Id: I90c8851e01de16b82617d60c987bad50a1522dd5

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-09 12:27:40.000000000', 'message': 'Allow PUT on direction param in QoS minimum pps rule

Based on discussion in the previous review [1] and IRC [2], it was
decided to allow direction parameter in QoS minimum packet rate
rule to be updated with a PUT request. This behavior matches current
behavior of other QoS rules.

If the rule to be updated is associated with a bound port, the request
is going to be rejected by the server.

Since direction-oriented and direction-less QoS min pps rules are
mutually exclusive, the request is going to be rejected if it would
result in mixing direction-oriented and direction-less rules in a single
policy.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/802486
[2] https://meetings.opendev.org/irclogs/%23openstack-neutron/latest.log.html#t2021-08-09T07:56:39

Related-Bug: #1922237
See-Also: https://review.opendev.org/785236
Change-Id: If1f7b28184c740c30388f564b704ba42c8967527

commit_message:
Allow PUT on direction param in QoS minimum pps rule

Based on discussion in the previous review [1] and IRC [2], it was
decided to allow direction parameter in QoS minimum packet rate
rule to be updated with a PUT request. This behavior matches current
behavior of other QoS rules.

If the rule to be updated is associated with a bound port, the request
is going to be rejected by the server.

Since direction-oriented and direction-less QoS min pps rules are
mutually exclusive, the request is going to be rejected if it would
result in mixing direction-oriented and direction-less rules in a single
policy.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/802486
[2] https://meetings.opendev.org/irclogs/%23openstack-neutron/latest.log.html#t2021-08-09T07:56:39

Related-Bug: #1922237
See-Also: https://review.opendev.org/785236
Change-Id: If1f7b28184c740c30388f564b704ba42c8967527

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-16 23:57:29.000000000', 'message': "[octavia-tempest-plugin] Tag train-last

Train branch is in Extended Maintenance now[1]. Tempest and
tempest plugins are branchless which means master version of
Tempest and its plugins is used to test the supported stable
branches.

Once any stable branch is moved to EM state then, Tempest and
its plugins compatible tag[2] needs to be released so that we can
keep testing the EM stable branches with that tag once master
Tempest and its plugins are not compatible[3].

Tagging 'train-last'[4] as well as a new version also with same hash.

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/train/index.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html
[3] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html
[4] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#extended-maintenance

Change-Id: I401f91c01f5fd72d8bcadd0f1cc2b15f255e2523
"}]
commit_message:
[octavia-tempest-plugin] Tag train-last

Train branch is in Extended Maintenance now[1]. Tempest and
tempest plugins are branchless which means master version of
Tempest and its plugins is used to test the supported stable
branches.

Once any stable branch is moved to EM state then, Tempest and
its plugins compatible tag[2] needs to be released so that we can
keep testing the EM stable branches with that tag once master
Tempest and its plugins are not compatible[3].

Tagging 'train-last'[4] as well as a new version also with same hash.

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/train/index.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html
[3] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html
[4] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#extended-maintenance

Change-Id: I401f91c01f5fd72d8bcadd0f1cc2b15f255e2523

commit_message:
Changed minversion in tox to 3.18.0

The patch bumps min version of tox to 3.18.0 in order to
replace tox's whitelist_externals by allowlist_externals option:
https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst#v3180-2020-07-23

Change-Id: I382ca56a7f04aba92fbff060e28df6814712a153

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-16 10:33:01.000000000', 'message': "container: return correct record type and policy index headers

When the proxy container controller constructs a listing from shards
it populates the body of the original root container response with
object records from the shards. However, the response headers were not
modified and so still had 'X-Backend-Record-Type' equal to
'shard'. The response headers also did not have a
'X-Backend-Record-Storage-Policy-Index' header. In both respects the
response differed from a listing response from an unsharded container.

This patch modifies the original root response 'X-Backend-Record-Type'
value to 'object' and adds 'X-Backend-Record-Storage-Policy-Index'
header with value equal to either the request
'X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index' header or, if that is not present,
the root response's 'X-Backend-Record-Storage-Policy-Index' header.

Change-Id: I7a9aa13bbe06bc6360040f489d4cbc220f09e2be

commit_message:
container: return correct record type and policy index headers

When the proxy container controller constructs a listing from shards
it populates the body of the original root container response with
object records from the shards. However, the response headers were not
modified and so still had 'X-Backend-Record-Type' equal to
'shard'. The response headers also did not have a
'X-Backend-Record-Storage-Policy-Index' header. In both respects the
response differed from a listing response from an unsharded container.

This patch modifies the original root response 'X-Backend-Record-Type'
value to 'object' and adds 'X-Backend-Record-Storage-Policy-Index'
header with value equal to either the request
'X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index' header or, if that is not present,
the root response's 'X-Backend-Record-Storage-Policy-Index' header.

Change-Id: I7a9aa13bbe06bc6360040f489d4cbc220f09e2be

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to an Openstack summit session [1], stestr is a maintained
project to which all Openstack projects should migrate. Let's switch to
stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Ie2169026d93ca85337db429c171ff1f82c2fa0d5

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-11 03:42:33.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of
dash-separated options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported
in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores.
Without this, we see 'UserWarning' messages
like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
      supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
            'description_file' instead

	          [1]
		  https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I39365ad5511672d8fb5803ef09afe47fa867a5d2
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of
dash-separated options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported
in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores.
Without this, we see 'UserWarning' messages
like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
      supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
            'description_file' instead

	          [1]
		  https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I39365ad5511672d8fb5803ef09afe47fa867a5d2

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-13 14:58:25.000000000', 'message': "Fix 'rabbitmqctl wait' timeout

`rabbitmqctl wait`'s default behavior changed recently
and a short timeout was introduced upstream. This
patch adapts our code in order to stay on the old,
intended behavior.

commit_message:
Fix 'rabbitmqctl wait' timeout

`rabbitmqctl wait`'s default behavior changed recently
and a short timeout was introduced upstream. This
patch adapts our code in order to stay on the old,
intended behavior.

Change-Id: I020e3e9e4976e21da08316ac58642b2058564b02

commit_message:
[SVF] Support volume-resize to hyperswap volume

[Spectrum Virtualize Family] Added support to extend a volume
which is created using hyperswap volume-type template

Implements: blueprint ibm-svf-hyperswap-volume-resize-support
Change-Id: I19bc034343bc106acb6a217bc5e53c7f60c58ef2

commit_message:
Install python3-croniter for nrpe checks

Change ab79c3ee introduced the croniter library for interacting
with cron. However, the dependent package was not included in
a list of installation packages nor installed on the upgrade
path. This patch adds the python3-croniter package for upgrade
and installation paths to allow the nrpe checks to continue
to function.

Change-Id: I363f8e04a3850eecf219c5a26ab9137f217a0f36
Closes-Bug: #1928802
(cherry picked from commit 38e1b4ed35de0034aaaea7bbf7f9ac44de88d409)

commit_message:
Add missing 'horizon-config' tag

There is a missing tag in the os-horizon-install.yml
file that leads to an undefined variable error when
running the playbook with '--tags horizon-config'

Change-Id: I77246d51a7880ef373ef4b33e199032d204f8b89
(cherry picked from commit 8e1b3f522ad94375519bbb11127b3087a9653c47)

commit_message:
Replace upgrades template when providers run again

The upgrades template was commented out to get
a change through that fixed failing content providers.

This template can be added back when the two
relevant release content provider jobs are
passing again.

Change-Id: Ib5f955d9df1b66125b20cbf7363779abd3e0d12a

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-11 05:43:54.000000000', 'message': 'Allow tuning of Galera gcache size

Appropriate gcache.size values allow a cluster node to perform IST
instead of SST if the writes occurred during its downtime do not exceed
the size of the cache itself.
This is especially beneficial during maintenance windows.

Change-Id: I483484c58ab703f3a4dcede636d733e23b051f63
(cherry picked from commit feed67dcc45eb3da818cc2ceac8cb3682a2b6364)

commit_message:
Allow tuning of Galera gcache size

Appropriate gcache.size values allow a cluster node to perform IST
instead of SST if the writes occurred during its downtime do not exceed
the size of the cache itself.
This is especially beneficial during maintenance windows.

Closes-Bug: #1939540

Change-Id: I483484c58ab703f3a4dcede636d733e23b051f63
(cherry picked from commit feed67dcc45eb3da818cc2ceac8cb3682a2b6364)
(cherry picked from commit 1ce9d8855db0e282a4a0c47e9afdee3f7a102c39)
(cherry picked from commit 165dcb2de05958c68e7e3ed46cd87b72c4f546fc)

[{'created': '2021-07-17 00:01:19.000000000', 'message': "[murano-tempest-plugin] Tag train-last

Train branch is in Extended Maintenance now[1]. Tempest and
tempest plugins are branchless which means master version of
Tempest and its plugins is used to test the supported stable

Once any stable branch is moved to EM state then, Tempest and

commit_message:
[murano-tempest-plugin] Tag train-last

Train branch is in Extended Maintenance now[1]. Tempest and
tempest plugins are branchless which means master version of
Tempest and its plugins is used to test the supported stable
branches.

Once any stable branch is moved to EM state then, Tempest and
its plugins compatible tag[2] needs to be released so that we can
keep testing the EM stable branches with that tag once master
Tempest and its plugins are not compatible[3].

Tagging 'train-last'[4] as well as a new version also with same hash.

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/train/index.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html
[3] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html
[4] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#extended-maintenance

Change-Id: I08915c84325c48dffe3232e0e41b33d1754ccf4d

[{'created': '2021-08-10 09:50:00.000000000', 'message': 'Make ARP protection commands compatible with "ebtables-nft"

"nftables" compatible binary, "ebtables-nft", is not 100% compatible
with the legacy API, as reported in LP#1922892.

This patch fixes the following issues when using "ebtables-nft" (while
keeping compatibility with legacy binary):
- When a new chain is created, a default DROP rule is added at the end
  of the chain (append). This will prevent the error code 4 when the
  chain is listed.
- The chain rules are added at the begining of the chain (insert),
  before the default DROP rule. This will prioritize the port rules.
- The MAC rules are cleaned before the new ones are added. That will
  prevent the deletion of any new needed rule, now added after the
  deletion.
- The "ebtables" command will retry on error code 4. This is the
  error returned when the chains are listed and no rule is present
  in a new created chain (reporeted in LP#1922892).

This code is backwards compatible, that means it works with the legacy
"ebtables" binary; this is currently installed in the Neutron CI [1].
In order to test with the new binary, "ebtables-nft", two new CI jobs
are added to the periodic queue [2].

[1]https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/1ad9ca56b07ffdc9f7e0bc6a62af61961b9128eb/roles/legacy_ebtables/tasks/main.yaml
[2]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/785144

commit_message:
Make ARP protection commands compatible with "ebtables-nft"

"nftables" compatible binary, "ebtables-nft", is not 100% compatible
with the legacy API, as reported in LP#1922892.

This patch fixes the following issues when using "ebtables-nft" (while
keeping compatibility with legacy binary):
- When a new chain is created, a default DROP rule is added at the end
  of the chain (append). This will prevent the error code 4 when the
  chain is listed.
- The chain rules are added at the begining of the chain (insert),
  before the default DROP rule. This will prioritize the port rules.
- The MAC rules are cleaned before the new ones are added. That will
  prevent the deletion of any new needed rule, now added after the
  deletion.
- The "ebtables" command will retry on error code 4. This is the
  error returned when the chains are listed and no rule is present
  in a new created chain (reporeted in LP#1922892).

This code is backwards compatible, that means it works with the legacy
"ebtables" binary; this is currently installed in the Neutron CI [1].
In order to test with the new binary, "ebtables-nft", two new CI jobs
are added to the periodic queue [2].

[1]https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/1ad9ca56b07ffdc9f7e0bc6a62af61961b9128eb/roles/legacy_ebtables/tasks/main.yaml
[2]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/785144

Closes-Bug: #1922892
Related-Bug: #1508155
Closes-Bug: #1938670

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/linuxbridge/agent/test_arp_protect.py

messages: [{'account_id': 32291, 'date': '2021-08-13 09:36:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-08-16 10:10:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nTrivial change so I'm fast approving it"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-13 09:36:00.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: If5cb829ef8530690f9208f9b15915e2c17367190
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: If5cb829ef8530690f9208f9b15915e2c17367190

W-1, waiting for feedback on a way to get the user's home/ssh dir from the env"}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-06-22 21:57:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> Patch Set 8: Workflow-1
> 
> W-1, waiting for feedback on a way to get the user's home/ssh dir from the env

Maybe it's easier to handle that in the tripleo-ansible change? From the heat templates side, maybe just if amp_ssh_key_dir is defined, then send the user defined value. If no value is given, then on the tripleo-ansible side {{ amp_ssh_key_dir | default(lookup('env', 'HOME')) }}

I'll test it out today and come back to you with my thoughts."}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-06-23 08:06:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> Patch Set 8:
> 
> > Patch Set 8: Workflow-1
> > 
> > W-1, waiting for feedback on a way to get the user's home/ssh dir from the env
> 
> Maybe it's easier to handle that in the tripleo-ansible change? From the heat templates side, maybe just if amp_ssh_key_dir is defined, then send the user defined value. If no value is given, then on the tripleo-ansible side {{ amp_ssh_key_dir | default(lookup('env', 'HOME')) }}
> 
> I'll test it out today and come back to you with my thoughts.

Yeah, I can't think of a better option for this. I think figuring it out from Ansible during the execution is the best way to handle this. You could probably add some more logic to it, like {{ (amp_ssh_key_dir | length > 0) | default(lookup('env','HOME')) }}

That might make it easier to default the amp_ssh_key_dir variable to '' in the Heat template and just let Ansible sort out the rest. I didn't test this last option though, so it might need some additional tweaking to make it work.

Either way, I think Ansible is the easier option for you to determine the running users home dir."}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-06-24 15:18:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 29244, 'date': '2021-07-12 07:36:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> >

> 
> Yeah, I can't think of a better option for this. I think figuring it out from Ansible during the execution is the best way to handle this. You could probably add some more logic to it, like {{ (amp_ssh_key_dir | length > 0) | default(lookup('env','HOME')) }}
> 
> That might make it easier to default the amp_ssh_key_dir variable to '' in the Heat template and just let Ansible sort out the rest. I didn't test this last option though, so it might need some additional tweaking to make it work.
> 
> Either way, I think Ansible is the easier option for you to determine the running users home dir.

I like this idea but the octavia playbook is run as root, so lookup('env', 'HOME') is /root/

I tried to find a way to get the name or the home of the user that runs tripleo, but I only found the "DeploymentUser" param which is defined only in standalone config files and that is no longer used anywhere, so I'm not sure we want to rely on it.

Another candidate would be to have an absolute path such as "/etc/octavia/ssh/" on the undercloud.'}, {'account_id': 29244, 'date': '2021-07-13 05:55:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 29244, 'date': '2021-07-13 05:56:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-07-13 06:05:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> 
> Another candidate would be to have an absolute path such as "/etc/octavia/ssh/" on the undercloud.

Hey,

Yeah. Understood. I think if it comes to requiring the key in a location like /etc/octavia/ssh it's probably better off being left in the current location (~/overcloud-deploy/...). I was mainly thinking from a user experience perspective that it would be easier if the user could find the key in a common location. 

There's no technical reason why having it in the currently location wouldn't be fine. I guess if we can just document that the key can be found in ~/overcloud-deploy/... so that users understand how they can find the key required to log into their Amphora VMs.'}, {'account_id': 29244, 'date': '2021-07-13 06:18:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

commit_message:
Add OctaviaAmphoraSshKeyDir for ssh key creation for Octavia

The Octavia playbook now creates a ssh key unless the user explicitly
sets the OctaviaAmphoraSshKeyFile parameter.
The playbook creates it in the OctaviaAmphoraSshKeyDir directory
(default: /etc/octavia/ssh).

Related-bug: #1907112
Change-Id: I4f31ddc3392e70cff1187ba8b9511af12df4b063

commit_message:
Remove destination when doing copy_from_local_path

Otherwise we risk ending up with a mix of old and new files, which can
be seen in the upgrade CI.

Change-Id: I3d9151423d28a73bdb0f2b6cf62c8aac1d0a91b5

Hi Goutham,
There is a problem with static initialization for dell_emc as its plugins having different support matrix. Netapp drv_multi_svm/drv_single_svm inherits ShareDriver which is missing in dell_emc plugins. 
So let us keep fix as it is. Opinion ??"}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2021-07-02 04:59:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> So let us keep fix as it is. Opinion ??

Hey Kiran, 
Thanks for checking. Those backends have a common share driver module; and a config option called "emc_share_backend" that can be used to check and set the property:

https://github.com/openstack/manila/blob/a5adb0bd11da734a14bfc9b51f128be90be3bab3/manila/share/drivers/dell_emc/driver.py#L69-L83'}, {'account_id': 32919, 'date': '2021-07-03 21:17:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 32912, 'date': '2021-07-03 21:47:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

"Mapping of share drivers and security services support" from https://docs.openstack.org/manila/rocky/admin/share_back_ends_feature_support_mapping.html# says security service support for Dell drivers. Also, from https://meetings.opendev.org/meetings/manila/2020/manila.2020-11-12-15.01.log.html, Dell drivers need Active Directory.

So this association is added, we can always remove them if its not needed. Or improve tempest tests.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-22 08:01:52.000000000', 'message': 'Early validate for CIFS without security service.

To create a share with protocol CIFS it is mandatory to add a security
service to the share network beforehand. If this is forgotten the share
ends up in error. Validate the security service association based on
share protocol from given driver. Raise invalid request exception if
needed association between share_network and security_service is
missing for given driver e.g. ONTAP.

Closes-Bug: #1900752
Change-Id: Ib7e9850e6439ee5d04f826d129afb1ab06950ce7

commit_message:
Early validate for CIFS without security service.

To create a share with protocol CIFS it is mandatory to add a security
service to the share network beforehand. If this is forgotten the share
ends up in error. Validate the security service association based on
share protocol from given driver. Raise invalid request exception if
needed association between share_network and security_service is
missing for given driver e.g. ONTAP.

DocImpact

Closes-Bug: #1900752
Change-Id: Ib7e9850e6439ee5d04f826d129afb1ab06950ce7

commit_message:
Add boto3 as s3 dependency for Glance container

boto3 library is needed [1] for glance_store and didn't installed yet
since [2] adds s3 support back. this change adds both binary and source
parts to install boto3 library.

1. https://github.com/openstack/glance_store/blob/04e5ead7c000211a4c10104ed2bb65c9df7681ae/setup.cfg#L76
2. I203134837319080ead96da69048baf90086d2117

Closes-Bug: #1884259
Change-Id: I199185e24cedd2e282c53460a24aeffc83478a12
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>

commit_message:
WIP - [STEIN ONLY] Fix issue with Gnocchi

Just testing out a possible solution for Stein.
The issue appears to be specific to the Gnocchi master
branch and python2. Testing to see whether locking to a
older branch solves the problem.

WIP to test if CI likes it now. No need to review or merge.

Change-Id: I4bd4ce9054a30ffaade3cb3ab01dc0dbc5621d7a

commit_message:
Partial Revert "Bump MariaDB version to 10.5.9"

This revert removes the workarounds needed for 10.5.9 due to
root user losing ability to grant privs.

This reverts commit 1db0ef2efbd22b3491e1cf57e172a3d87b6f62a9.

Change-Id: Iedd3cba5f1ccb6bdc4990d839a86e23825480d2f

commit_message:
Add support of OVN for CentOS-8-Stream

This patch will adjust some variable for C8-Stream job to fix
OVN deployment for CentOS-8-Stream. Renamed ovn-central with
ovn-northd for more generic name.

Change-Id: Ifdb773f9f539469e21d37075f6b88259eb1ffa3e

commit_message:
Create queens-eol tag for networking-bgpvpn and networking-bagpipe

CI for those projects in stable/queens is broken e.g. because it requires
Horizon which is already EOL in Queens.
Last patches were merged in those repositories around 2019.

Change-Id: I7a55b58d3a7de1f3cbf8f3d0784e8ed9e4e7f6bc

subject: Do not install libvirt python bindings from pip
messages:
[{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-15 14:53:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-15 14:54:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-15 14:58:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2021-08-16 07:01:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2021-08-16 08:16:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Thank you and I agree in general. Also kudos to find the offending patch.

I *think* pip in debian/ubuntu can handle distro packages, where in rpm based distros, it can not.
When I touched this piece of code last week, CI checks were passing on both ubuntu and rhel.
Testing on rhel was only introduced/tried last week during the initiative of enabling fips in CI.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-16 08:23:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2021-08-16 08:25:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Thank you, this looks good to me.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-16 08:29:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-16 09:19:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

While we are still waiting verification by zuul , the fix is promising now according to https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/aodh/+/804595'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-16 09:20:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> Thank you and I agree in general. Also kudos to find the offending patch.
> 
> I *think* pip in debian/ubuntu can handle distro packages, where in rpm based distros, it can not.
> When I touched this piece of code last week, CI checks were passing on both ubuntu and rhel.
> Testing on rhel was only introduced/tried last week during the initiative of enabling fips in CI.

Just for another record...

It seems the issue can be reproduced in Ubuntu. I guess we didn't hit the issue in Ubuntu because there was no version difference between pip and distro packages but I'm not quite sure about that.

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/3dca30953cc046d386d4b190e62cc666"}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2021-08-16 10:08:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1

thank you'}]

commit_message:
Do not install libvirt python bindings from pip

Since [1] was merged, devstack no longer installs libvirt python
bindings from pip but use distro packages. This change removes
the logic to install the python bindings using pip to follow that
change in devstack, otherwise installation fails because of conflict
between packages available in pip and one installed by distro packages.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/798514

Closes-Bug: #1939990
Related-Bug: #1933096
Change-Id: I369a95cf30e91738d10ad2e5a3d5f6988bdd76cb

commit_message:
Replace deprecated import of ABCs from collections

ABCs in collections should be imported from collections.abc and direct
import from collections is deprecated since Python 3.3.

commit_message:
dnf: add metalink argument to custom dnf repository

As per [1] mandatory configuration option is either baseurl, mirrorlist
or metalink.

EPEL repos use metalink and it's impossible to configure them via DNF
custom repos functionality right now.

[1]: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/collections/ansible/builtin/yum_repository_module.html#parameter-metalink

Change-Id: Ib267b648f011a7efa6440b6adf9ea8b9b5a0931f

commit_message:
Replace deprecated oslo_utils.timeutils.isotime

The isotime method in oslo_utils.timeutils module was deprecated long
ago[1], and remaining usage of the deprecated method causes
DeprecationWarning[2].
This change replaces the deprecated method by a new method implemented
as part of utility methods.

[1] 5cad113739fa906c3901e530fcbfdee3b48961c1

[2] DeprecationWarning: Using function/method 'isotime()' is deprecated
    in version '1.6' and will be removed in a future version: use
    datetime.datetime.isoformat()

Change-Id: I2371e66d84ce8226700d32c90c0730b7c7e607a0

commit_message:
ironic: Follow up for ironic_enable_keystone_integration

Follow up for I0c7e9a28876a1d4278fb2ed8555c2b08472864b9 which added a
ironic_enable_keystone_integration variable to support Ironic in
multi-region environments. This change skips Keystone service
registration based on ironic_enable_keystone_integration rather than
enable_keystone. It also updates the ironic-inspector.conf template to
use the new variable.

Change-Id: I2ecba4999e194766258ac5beed62877d43829313
(cherry picked from commit 46df30d87140d182acfc70b005fb8b29a4589c12)

subject: OVN DBs clustering
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-13 10:11:09.000000000', 'message': 'OVN DBs clustering

We introduce support for running both the NB and SB OVN databases in
clustered mode. This OVN DBs clustered mode is based on OVNs own
clustering protocol and does not rely on pacemaker.

Clustering the two OVN databases increases reliability. The cluster
works in active-active mode and has the potential to be more
resilient and performant.

See
https://docs.openvswitch.org/en/latest/ref/ovsdb.7/#clustered-database-service-model
for more information.

For backport simplicity we also add I50cf3b7d79d8cd139ae514438e147df73901a366
("Fix typo in ovn-dbs-cluster northd kolla config file") which
is a cherry-pick + squash of commit 1115698c14788555510edbe1760bbc9cc9110dff,
so we avoid ovn_northd connecting only to the local db via unix socket.

Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>

Related-Bug: #1931133
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/804435
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/795763

NB: Some changes for this ussuri (just like for victoria) backport are needed:
- Readd DefaultPasswords:
- go back to the old way of doing TLS (i.e. no system-roles.certificate)
- template version back to rocky
- Set tripleo_container_manage_systemd_order: false (I believe it was a
  mistake to start with and we removed it in master as well)

Change-Id: I59bfe69dbb5f3d525ac6f6d655577d24036328c0
(cherry picked from commit baf4a16149d2a31ccb331cc96b89871e71c00734)
(cherry picked from commit 15433f131ceee8e8df6e8ca60b0703467fbbf310)
(cherry picked from commit 40da6ed23462369add64c9c2907926eb632816d0)
'}]
commit_message:
OVN DBs clustering

We introduce support for running both the NB and SB OVN databases in
clustered mode. This OVN DBs clustered mode is based on OVNs own
clustering protocol and does not rely on pacemaker.

Clustering the two OVN databases increases reliability. The cluster
works in active-active mode and has the potential to be more
resilient and performant.

See
https://docs.openvswitch.org/en/latest/ref/ovsdb.7/#clustered-database-service-model
for more information.

For backport simplicity we also add I50cf3b7d79d8cd139ae514438e147df73901a366
("Fix typo in ovn-dbs-cluster northd kolla config file") which
is a cherry-pick + squash of commit 1115698c14788555510edbe1760bbc9cc9110dff,
so we avoid ovn_northd connecting only to the local db via unix socket.

Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>

Related-Bug: #1931133
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/804435
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/795763

NB: Some changes for this ussuri (just like for victoria) backport are needed:
- Readd DefaultPasswords:
- go back to the old way of doing TLS (i.e. no system-roles.certificate)
- template version back to rocky
- Set tripleo_container_manage_systemd_order: false (I believe it was a
  mistake to start with and we removed it in master as well)

Change-Id: I59bfe69dbb5f3d525ac6f6d655577d24036328c0
(cherry picked from commit baf4a16149d2a31ccb331cc96b89871e71c00734)
(cherry picked from commit 15433f131ceee8e8df6e8ca60b0703467fbbf310)
(cherry picked from commit 40da6ed23462369add64c9c2907926eb632816d0)

'}, {'created': '2021-08-11 09:43:27.000000000', 'message': "Allow BFD timeouts to be customized

Especially in virtual environments the default rfc-specified BFD timeouts are quite
aggressive. A small overload on the control plane has the chances of
making us miss heartbeat and declaring a link down.

Let's add some parameters (set to the RFC-defined defaults) in order to
be able to customize them.

Tested with:
  ControllerRack1ExtraGroupVars:
    tripleo_frr_bfd_detect_multiplier: 10
    tripleo_frr_bfd_transmit_interval: 500
    tripleo_frr_bfd_receive_interval: 500

Obtained the following in the config:
router bgp 64999
  bgp router-id 172.30.1.1
  bgp log-neighbor-changes
  bgp graceful-shutdown
...
  neighbor uplink peer-group
  neighbor uplink bfd
  neighbor uplink bfd profile tripleo
...
bfd
  profile tripleo
    detect-multiplier 10
    transmit-interval 500
    receive-interval 500

vtysh confirms that the config is applied correctly:
[root@ctrl-1-0 ~]# podman exec -it frr vtysh -c 'show running-config' |grep -A4 bfd
router bgp 64999
 bgp router-id 172.30.1.1
 bgp log-neighbor-changes
--
   neighbor uplink bfd
 neighbor uplink bfd profile tripleo
 neighbor uplink ttl-security hops 1
 neighbor enp2s0 interface peer-group uplink
 neighbor enp3s0 interface peer-group uplink
 !
--
  bfd
 profile tripleo
  detect-multiplier 10
  transmit-interval 500
  receive-interval 500

Change-Id: I8ff745be02b476bcfeac1bfd162902d6fffdd6cb
"}]
commit_message:
Allow BFD timeouts to be customized

Especially in virtual environments the default rfc-specified BFD timeouts are quite
aggressive. A small overload on the control plane has the chances of
making us miss heartbeat and declaring a link down.

Let's add some parameters (set to the RFC-defined defaults) in order to
be able to customize them.

Tested with:
  ControllerRack1ExtraGroupVars:
    tripleo_frr_bfd_detect_multiplier: 10
    tripleo_frr_bfd_transmit_interval: 500
    tripleo_frr_bfd_receive_interval: 500

Obtained the following in the config:
router bgp 64999
  bgp router-id 172.30.1.1
  bgp log-neighbor-changes
  bgp graceful-shutdown
...
  neighbor uplink peer-group
  neighbor uplink bfd
  neighbor uplink bfd profile tripleo
...
bfd
  profile tripleo
    detect-multiplier 10
    transmit-interval 500
    receive-interval 500

vtysh confirms that the config is applied correctly:
[root@ctrl-1-0 ~]# podman exec -it frr vtysh -c 'show running-config' |grep -A4 bfd
router bgp 64999
 bgp router-id 172.30.1.1
 bgp log-neighbor-changes
--
   neighbor uplink bfd
 neighbor uplink bfd profile tripleo
 neighbor uplink ttl-security hops 1
 neighbor enp2s0 interface peer-group uplink
 neighbor enp3s0 interface peer-group uplink
 !
--
  bfd
 profile tripleo
  detect-multiplier 10
  transmit-interval 500
  receive-interval 500

Change-Id: I8ff745be02b476bcfeac1bfd162902d6fffdd6cb

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-10 10:48:44.000000000', 'message': "Extra var ironic_enable_keystone_integration added.

Basically, there are three main installation scenario:

Scenario 1:
Ironic installation together with other openstack services
including keystone. In this case variable enable_keystone
is set to true and keystone service will be installed
together with ironic installation. It is possible realise this
scenario, no fix needed

Scenario 2:
Ironic installation with connection to already installed
keystone. In this scenario we have to set enable_keystone
to “No” to prevent from new keystone service installation
during the ironic installation process. But in other hand,
we need to have correct sections in ironic.conf to provide
all information needed to connect to existing keystone.
But all sections for keystone are added to ironic.conf only
if enable_keystone var is set to “Yes”. It isn’t possible
to realise this scenario. Proposed fix provide support for
this scenario, where multiple regions share the same
keystone service.

Scenario 3:
No keystone integration. Ironic don't connect to Keystone.
It is possible realise this scenario, no fix needed

Proposed solution also keep the default behaviour: if no
enable_keystone_integration is manually defined by default
it takes value of enable_keystone variable and all behaviour
is the same. But if we don't want to install keystone and
want to connect to existing one at the same time, it will be
possible to set enable_keystone var to “No”
(preventing keystone from installation) and at the same
time set ironic_enable_keystone_integration to Yes to allow
needed section appear in ironic.conf through templating.

Change-Id: I0c7e9a28876a1d4278fb2ed8555c2b08472864b9
(cherry picked from commit da4fd2d6a2e3fdca981babf37ab0f3307ee1eb2a)
"}]
commit_message:
Extra var ironic_enable_keystone_integration added.

Basically, there are three main installation scenario:

Scenario 1:
Ironic installation together with other openstack services
including keystone. In this case variable enable_keystone
is set to true and keystone service will be installed
together with ironic installation. It is possible realise this
scenario, no fix needed

Scenario 2:
Ironic installation with connection to already installed
keystone. In this scenario we have to set enable_keystone
to “No” to prevent from new keystone service installation
during the ironic installation process. But in other hand,
we need to have correct sections in ironic.conf to provide
all information needed to connect to existing keystone.
But all sections for keystone are added to ironic.conf only
if enable_keystone var is set to “Yes”. It isn’t possible
to realise this scenario. Proposed fix provide support for
this scenario, where multiple regions share the same
keystone service.

Scenario 3:
No keystone integration. Ironic don't connect to Keystone.
It is possible realise this scenario, no fix needed

Proposed solution also keep the default behaviour: if no
enable_keystone_integration is manually defined by default
it takes value of enable_keystone variable and all behaviour
is the same. But if we don't want to install keystone and
want to connect to existing one at the same time, it will be
possible to set enable_keystone var to “No”
(preventing keystone from installation) and at the same
time set ironic_enable_keystone_integration to Yes to allow
needed section appear in ironic.conf through templating.

Change-Id: I0c7e9a28876a1d4278fb2ed8555c2b08472864b9
(cherry picked from commit da4fd2d6a2e3fdca981babf37ab0f3307ee1eb2a)

[{'created': '2021-08-10 12:27:59.000000000', 'message': "Fix permissions for files created on repo server

If wheels or requirements files are created on a secondary
repo server these cannot be modified/deleted by the primary
repo server when it comes back online as this uses rsync as the
'nginx' user. This patch allows the owner of the created files
to be set explicitly to avoid this issue.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ansible-role-python_venv_build/+/804073
Change-Id: Ifdbac876013068855cd4405ca1bbacd262ec4d74
"}]
commit_message:
Fix permissions for files created on repo server

If wheels or requirements files are created on a secondary
repo server these cannot be modified/deleted by the primary
repo server when it comes back online as this uses rsync as the
'nginx' user. This patch allows the owner of the created files
to be set explicitly to avoid this issue.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ansible-role-python_venv_build/+/804073
Change-Id: Ifdbac876013068855cd4405ca1bbacd262ec4d74

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-08-10 15:20:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-08-11 08:07:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-11 10:17:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

redhat-lsb-core moves our base hosts too far away from a "minimal docker/podman host" - need to find another way to check for stream'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-08-11 12:42:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1
> 
> redhat-lsb-core moves our base hosts too far away from a "minimal docker/podman host" - need to find another way to check for stream

Happy to understand why a normal Debuntu host responds to lsb_release -a and fills out ansible_lsb fact, and installing the package that delivers that on CentOS is far away from minimal docker host, ;-)
Without slurping /etc/centos-release or running a command on remote hosts - there's no other way (and that one looks way better than the alternatives).'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-11 17:16:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4:
> 
> > Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1
> > 
> > redhat-lsb-core moves our base hosts too far away from a "minimal docker/podman host" - need to find another way to check for stream
> 
> Happy to understand why a normal Debuntu host responds to lsb_release -a and fills out ansible_lsb fact, and installing the package that delivers that on CentOS is far away from minimal docker host, ;-)
> Without slurping /etc/centos-release or running a command on remote hosts - there's no other way (and that one looks way better than the alternatives).

Well, the issue is that redhat-lsb-core pulls in dependencies defined by LSB Core, including the default mail and printing services. 😊 I suggest you just check if there is "Stream" mentioned in /etc/centos-release and we are fine and still with minimal footprint.'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-08-12 10:02:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4:
> 
> > Patch Set 4:
> > 
> > > Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1
> > > 
> > > redhat-lsb-core moves our base hosts too far away from a "minimal docker/podman host" - need to find another way to check for stream
> > 
> > Happy to understand why a normal Debuntu host responds to lsb_release -a and fills out ansible_lsb fact, and installing the package that delivers that on CentOS is far away from minimal docker host, ;-)
> > Without slurping /etc/centos-release or running a command on remote hosts - there's no other way (and that one looks way better than the alternatives).
> 
> Well, the issue is that redhat-lsb-core pulls in dependencies defined by LSB Core, including the default mail and printing services. 😊 I suggest you just check if there is "Stream" mentioned in /etc/centos-release and we are fine and still with minimal footprint.

oh come on, cups client, at, ed, and others 😊
What is interesting, newer Ansible handles that better - https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/73034

Let me rework...'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-08-12 10:08:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-12 11:41:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

nice now'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-08-12 12:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Published edit on patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-12 12:45:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Published edit on patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-12 12:46:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

fixed the last "8" for you'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-08-16 09:13:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
fluentd: Fix check for external elasticsearch

When enable_elasticsearch is False, and kolla_internal_fqdn is set
and elasticsearch_address is the default, fluentd is still enabling
output to elasticsearch.

elasticsearch_address defaults to kolla_internal_fqdn, but the
check to enable logging to an "external" elasticsearch host
compares with kolla_internal_vip_address (fqdn != vip address).

This patch fixes the comparison to use the kolla_internal_fqdn.

Closes-Bug: #1927880
Change-Id: If23a6b1273c2639d1296becc9d222546d52f63ac
(cherry picked from commit 283b0dec639c032945f5d1d87a66f0c7541c0562)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-11 15:50:10.000000000', 'message': '[release] Use RDO master Delorean packages

Change-Id: I2295884ef3b4c3bf4b087599322b0c5761e7b775
'}, {'created': '2021-08-11 17:53:43.000000000', 'message': '[release] Use RDO master Delorean packages

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/804288

Change-Id: I2295884ef3b4c3bf4b087599322b0c5761e7b775
'}, {'created': '2021-08-12 08:07:36.000000000', 'message': "[release] Use RDO master Delorean packages

CentOS binary packages for Xena have moved Neutron's api-paste.ini file
to /etc/neutron [1]. Make this file available at the old location [2]
for compatiblity with kolla-ansible, until the configuration is modified
to use the new location.

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/openstack/neutron-distgit/+/34845
[2] /usr/share/neutron/api-paste.ini

Change-Id: I2295884ef3b4c3bf4b087599322b0c5761e7b775
"}]
commit_message:
[release] Use RDO master Delorean packages

CentOS binary packages for Xena have moved Neutron's api-paste.ini file
to /etc/neutron [1]. Make this file available at the old location [2]
for compatiblity with kolla-ansible, until the configuration is modified
to use the new location.

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/openstack/neutron-distgit/+/34845
[2] /usr/share/neutron/api-paste.ini

Change-Id: I2295884ef3b4c3bf4b087599322b0c5761e7b775

commit_message:
Add tripleo_ovn_cluster role

We introduce support for running both the NB and SB OVN databases in
clustered mode. This OVN DBs clustered mode is based on OVN's own
clustering protocol and does not rely on pacemaker.

THT service: https://review.opendev.org/775444

Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
Change-Id: I5baa697ae351d10e53f7cf70641fe0eecede507f
(cherry picked from commit 3af0816934d27d8a175f839805f51c6804068317)

This addresses an issue when upgrading between different operating
systems. In this case, the requirements files already exist for
the old OS, which prevents new wheels from being created for the

commit_message:
Add distro/arch to requirements file path

This addresses an issue when upgrading between different operating
systems. In this case, the requirements files already exist for
the old OS, which prevents new wheels from being created for the
new OS. By using a different requirements path for each OS this is
avoided.

As part of this, repeated variable construction for the
requirements path is factored our into a vars file.

Change-Id: I881a40fee31df78bf96e451509671543a49520d9

commit_message:
Add variables to set permissions for created files

When this role is used alongside the OSA repo server it is
important to be able to control file and directory permissions.
This patch adds variables to optionally set these when creating
requirements files and wheels.

Change-Id: I1131a7e9aa2345d4c07a88a2ad2c8a36e7a35d2b
(cherry picked from commit 1f69673fe2f3be270418da8e131987088eff31c4)

subject: Fix erlang upgrades for rabbitmq external_repo installs
messages:
[{'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-08-06 08:55:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-08-06 08:56:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Requires further testing, including what happens on non-arm hosts which currently have the erlang-base-hipe package installed.'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-08-10 13:50:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-08-10 13:55:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

This patch should be checked for risks around the erlang-base switch. If a deployment uses erlang-base-hipe and applies this patch at a time when a RabbitMQ version upgrade isn't happening then it may cause a failure as the dependency installation will trigger a dpkg-reconfigure of the RabbitMQ package."}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-08-10 13:56:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> This patch should be checked for risks around the erlang-base switch. If a deployment uses erlang-base-hipe and applies this patch at a time when a RabbitMQ version upgrade isn't happening then it may cause a failure as the dependency installation will trigger a dpkg-reconfigure of the RabbitMQ package.

The simplest option may be to add a release note to suggest setting '-e rabbitmq_upgrade=true', but this won't catch all cases if people don't read the notes."}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-08-10 15:08:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think we need to also edit debian-11.yml?'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-08-10 15:10:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> I think we need to also edit debian-11.yml?

Good point. The fact that uses a lower rabbitmq version also suggests a debian 10->11 upgrade may struggle at the moment.'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-08-10 15:12:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-08-11 07:13:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-08-14 08:08:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-08-16 07:51:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2021-08-06 08:55:57.000000000', 'message': "Fix erlang upgrades for rabbitmq external_repo installs

Upgrading only the 'erlang' package does not pull in updated
dependencies which can cause rabbitmq to fail to start during an
upgrade.

The external and distro dependencies appear to match, so these
are conformed to ensure that all packages are updated during an
upgrade.

Change-Id: I8bd010cba13946c9c46c3792624841e41e3c2eaf
"}, {'created': '2021-08-10 13:50:34.000000000', 'message': "Fix erlang upgrades for rabbitmq external_repo installs

Upgrading only the 'erlang' package does not pull in updated
dependencies which can cause rabbitmq to fail to start during an
upgrade.

The external and distro dependencies appear to match, so these

This patch additionally switches deployments to the 'erlang-base'

Change-Id: I8bd010cba13946c9c46c3792624841e41e3c2eaf

upgrade.

The external and distro dependencies appear to match, so these
are conformed to ensure that all packages are updated during an

Change-Id: I8bd010cba13946c9c46c3792624841e41e3c2eaf

commit_message:
Fix erlang upgrades for rabbitmq external_repo installs

Upgrading only the 'erlang' package does not pull in updated
dependencies which can cause rabbitmq to fail to start during an
upgrade.

The external and distro dependencies appear to match, so these
are conformed to ensure that all packages are updated during an
upgrade.

This patch additionally switches deployments to the 'erlang-base'
rather than 'erlang-base-hipe' package which appears to have been
discontinued.

Change-Id: I8bd010cba13946c9c46c3792624841e41e3c2eaf

commit_message:
Remove a sample file of masakari.conf

This patch removes a sample file of masakari.conf.
Because masakari configuration file can be generated by
"tox -egenconfig" command now.

This is a trivial fix.

commit_message:
tests: Remove use of 'oslo_db.sqlalchemy.test_base'

The various test cases and mixins in 'oslo_db.sqlalchemy.test_base' have
been deprecated since oslo.db 4.34.0 (March 2018). Remove use of these.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8f4d55c397f61777bec830855f229e5fe5af90dc

commit_message:
Add missing oslo.service options

The oslo.service library provides multiple oslo.config.opts endpoints
for sub modules. This change adds missing endpoints so that all valid
parameters are rendered by oslo-config-generator.

Change-Id: I5eee536e7c12702fd5190ba60cf13ebc5b4e2382

commit_message:
Add missing [oslo_reports] options

The oslo.reports library provides some options under the [oslo_reports]
section. This change ensures these parameters are rendered by
the oslo-config-generator command.

Change-Id: I851b856e622fdc7aada49b27ef01a1010a6afd5b

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-08-16 07:07:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Do we need to have two separate extensions one for the resource_request with groups and one for the allocation with groups? I'm not against it just wondering if we ever use the allocation extension without the resource_request extension."}, {'account_id': 33652, 'date': '2021-08-16 07:16:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> Do we need to have two separate extensions one for the resource_request with groups and one for the allocation with groups? I'm not against it just wondering if we ever use the allocation extension without the resource_request extension.

I don't think those extensions will ever be used separately, as they depend on each other anyways.
I like the idea of keeping it simple and adding only 1 shim extension."}, {'account_id': 33652, 'date': '2021-08-16 08:45:55.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

After a discussion with @Lajos, @Bence and @Balazs we agreed that additional extension is not needed. If port-resource-request-groups extension is supported, it already implies that Nova has to use a new format of 'allocation' key in the 'binding:profile'."}]

commit_message:
Add port-binding-allocation-groups shim API extension

Add a new shim API extension definition called
port-binding-allocation-groups. This extension indicates that
Neutron supports port binding for ports with two groups of resource
requests.

Based on this extension, Nova will know that it can send the new format
of 'allocation' key in the 'binding:profile'.

Related-Bug: #1922237
See-Also: https://review.opendev.org/785236
Change-Id: I8b18785f37847804dd84e810544e95538d1a56e1

commit_message:
Add V and W jobs to zuul check

This change adds the V and W openstack release jobs to the zuul
check list. This will bring OSH testing more in line with the latest
supported releases of OpenStack.

commit_message:
Run helm3 linter in check

This change adds a helm3 linter to the zuul check job list. The job
currently emits some warnings, these will be cleared up in future
changes.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-02 14:35:45.000000000', 'message': '[openstacksdk] Propose to switch the release model

Intermediary-released deliverables that did release only once during
the last cycle, and have not done a release yet are good candidates
to switch to the cycle-with-rc model, which is much more suitable for
deliverables that are only released once per cycle.

These changes are not mandatory and this patch is a conveniences to
highlight this point and open the discussion.

PTLs and release liaisons please decide to:
- immediately release an intermediary release (and -1 the proposed change)
- confirm the release model change (+1 the proposed change)
- stay uncertain for this cycle of how many releases will be made, but
  acknowledge that they need to do a release before RC1 (-1 the proposed
  change)

Change-Id: I22d5bf0370adb83da5750c29b90484fb1a75ed4a

commit_message:
[openstacksdk] Propose to switch the release model

Intermediary-released deliverables that did release only once during
the last cycle, and have not done a release yet are good candidates
to switch to the cycle-with-rc model, which is much more suitable for
deliverables that are only released once per cycle.

These changes are not mandatory and this patch is a conveniences to
highlight this point and open the discussion.

PTLs and release liaisons please decide to:
- immediately release an intermediary release (and -1 the proposed change)
- confirm the release model change (+1 the proposed change)
- stay uncertain for this cycle of how many releases will be made, but
  acknowledge that they need to do a release before RC1 (-1 the proposed
  change)

Change-Id: I22d5bf0370adb83da5750c29b90484fb1a75ed4a

subject: use keystone custom certificates from remote host
messages:
[{'account_id': 33872, 'date': '2021-08-11 06:21:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-08-11 07:54:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Sven,

I see you've made several commits all looking related to keystone SSL setup in openstack-ansible. For this one in particular note that we have introduced a new ansible role ansible-role-pki in the Wallaby release, and as part of the current work for Xena will be replacing the code you are modifying here in this patch with something along the lines of this https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server/commit/840f47f4b9e2874019630fd70a77fe31be6aacd0

I'm also not sure I understand what 'remote_src: true' would mean for an LXC deployment - where would the remote cert come from in that case?

For the commit messages in general it would be great to try to do them in 3 parts, title, explanation of whats currently broken, what this change does to fix it. Makes the patches much easier to review."}, {'account_id': 33872, 'date': '2021-08-11 08:48:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Hi Sven,
> 
> I see you've made several commits all looking related to keystone SSL setup in openstack-ansible. For this one in particular note that we have introduced a new ansible role ansible-role-pki in the Wallaby release, and as part of the current work for Xena will be replacing the code you are modifying here in this patch with something along the lines of this https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server/commit/840f47f4b9e2874019630fd70a77fe31be6aacd0
> 
> I'm also not sure I understand what 'remote_src: true' would mean for an LXC deployment - where would the remote cert come from in that case?
> 
> For the commit messages in general it would be great to try to do them in 3 parts, title, explanation of whats currently broken, what this change does to fix it. Makes the patches much easier to review.

Hi Jonathan,
thank you for your review. I would like to apologize for the bad commit 
message. Its my first contribution to openstack.  What is the best way to fix 
this mistake?

In our case, we have a own self implemented company PKI systems which 
generates/copies certificates to the destination host and not the machine where 
the ansible-playbook job is running. 

At the Moment the os_keystone role can not handle this. It will always copy 
the keys from the machine, where the ansible-playbook job is run.

If remote_src is yes (default no), the key will be copied from the remote 
machine. 

See copy module doc: https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/collections/
ansible/builtin/copy_module.html

Best Regards
Sven Anders"}, {'account_id': 33872, 'date': '2021-08-11 12:44:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-08-12 04:05:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hey,

While I see what you're trying to achive, I agree with jrosser that keystone role should leverage our PKI blueprint https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-specs/specs/wallaby/ssl-root-ca.html and be changed to use https://opendev.org/openstack/ansible-role-pki instead. I believe this should solve your user story as well since you will be able to set pki_setup_host as a host where certs are located.


It would be awesome if you could look through that pki role and make a change to os_keystone to switch to using it."}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-08-16 07:47:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-11 06:21:51.000000000', 'message': 'use keystone custom certificates from remote host

Change-Id: I41bc0082f5ffce843f02ba34a97c7792b1ff16c3
'}, {'created': '2021-08-11 12:44:07.000000000', 'message': 'use keystone custom certificates from remote host

In our case, we have a own self implemented company PKI systems which 
generates/copies certificates to the destination host and not the machine where 
the ansible-playbook job is running. 

At the Moment the os_keystone role can not handle this. It will always copy 
the keys from the machine, where the ansible-playbook job is run.

If remote_src is yes (default no), the key will be copied from the remote 
machine. 

Change-Id: I41bc0082f5ffce843f02ba34a97c7792b1ff16c3
'}]
commit_message:
use keystone custom certificates from remote host

In our case, we have a own self implemented company PKI systems which 
generates/copies certificates to the destination host and not the machine where 
the ansible-playbook job is running. 

At the Moment the os_keystone role can not handle this. It will always copy 
the keys from the machine, where the ansible-playbook job is run.

If remote_src is yes (default no), the key will be copied from the remote 
machine. 

Change-Id: I41bc0082f5ffce843f02ba34a97c7792b1ff16c3

Sorry, I don't understand why you say that there is no quota_classes... We have the REST API to create them: https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v3/#update-quota-classes-for-a-project

I believe the code this patch is trying to remove is necessary, so I'll -2 the patch for the moment, but I'll change it if I'm proved wrong."}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2021-01-19 08:45:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4: Code-Review-2
> 
> Sorry, I don't understand why you say that there is no quota_classes... We have the REST API to create them: https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v3/#update-quota-classes-for-a-project
> 
> I believe the code this patch is trying to remove is necessary, so I'll -2 the patch for the moment, but I'll change it if I'm proved wrong.

thanks for your review, Gorka Eguileor.
i know we have rest to create some item in quota_class table, we can set default quota for all new project. but it doesn't make sense to set default quota for an volume type with specified name("%s_%s" % (quota_type, volulme_type_name)), because we do not know the volume type name before we create it. this means "%s_%s" % (quota_type, volulme_type_name) will not appear in quota_class table. even if we set it in manually, it means nothing. so we not necessary try to update it when update volume type name.'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2021-01-19 11:01:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Hi Haixin,

There may be a misunderstanding, as you mention that the name may not be known on creation, but this is called upon updating the name of a type.

So here's a case where this is necessary:

- Create volume type
- Update quota class for that type
- Update the volume type name

If I'm not mistaken, this patch removes the code that preserves the connection between the volume type and the quota class.  So without that update the volume type will have a new name and the quota class will no longer apply to it."}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2021-01-20 07:12:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4:
> 
> Hi Haixin,
> 
> There may be a misunderstanding, as you mention that the name may not be known on creation, but this is called upon updating the name of a type.
> 
> So here's a case where this is necessary:
> 
> - Create volume type
> - Update quota class for that type
> - Update the volume type name
> 
> If I'm not mistaken, this patch removes the code that preserves the connection between the volume type and the quota class.  So without that update the volume type will have a new name and the quota class will no longer apply to it.

Hi, Gorka Eguileor.
    As we know, quota_class is used to set default quota for all new project, but not an specified project, so i think it should be true for volume type. maybe we need another patch to fix this logic about this. after fixed, we can set default quota in quota_class for all new volume type, instead of for an specified volume type with type name.
    After we create an volume type, if we want to set quota for it, we just need to update quota for that type, but not update quota class. 
    Default quota means we set default quota before we create resource, and all new created resource follow this quota value. rather than we can noly set default quota after we creat resource.
    Any new volume type should follow default quota in quota class if we have set, otherwise quota is unlimited. if need to set quota after created, just to update quota table for it.
   how do you think?"}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2021-08-16 07:27:54.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Remove invalid quota resource when update volume type name

There is no such resource named as "%s_%s" %
(quota_type, volulme_type_name) in database table of quota_classes.
,there are only quota default value for new project.
Unless we manually set the default quota for volume type. These values
are default values, and we don't know how the user will name the volume
type before we create it,So it doesn't make sense to preset a default
value for a volume type in advance.

so resource named as "%s_%s" % (quota_type, volulme_type_name) only
exist in table quota_usages or quotas if we set quota for specified
volume type.
will not appear in table of quota_classes.

so we not need to call quota_class_update_resource when update volume
type name.

Closes-Bug: #1909630
Change-Id: If395e63bd2cb22b5bc3f807755631b81ad3ac015
