commit_message:
Enable health check httpchk options in haproxy.

Adds backend options for 'admin-port' and 'public-port' in
HAProxyContext. HAProxy will now expect 200-300 statuses and the string
"stable".

test_haproxy_context_service_enabled updated to reflect expected ctxt.

Closes-Bug: #1933233
Change-Id: I88cef4539f5d7dc70f6fbaacfb2ff768e958d346

subject: Revert "Workaround for new pip 20.3 behavior"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 30491, 'name': 'Radosław Piliszek', 'email': 'radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com', 'username': 'yoctozepto'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2021-07-28 01:21:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2021-07-28 04:14:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2021-07-28 06:34:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

Sigh, we tacitly pin pip to 20 on focal (I7af194ecc40e4d43c10ce067a661bb6ab4ca37d4)

This is still broken.  

This came in with I0f07858e96ea3baf46f8a453e253b9ed29c7f7e2

I think what is happen in words here is "take <project> out of upper-constraints.txt, and replace it with the checkout on disk, such that if anything using upper-constraints.txt has a requirement on <project> it will install from this source tree on disk, not pypi, etc."

I suspect we can remove this.  If we remove ourselves from upper-constraints.txt before installing, then surely it must mean that the dependency solver will just choose whatever the "latest" is and install that?  and the latest must be what's on disk, which is what we're just about to install...'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2021-07-28 06:40:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2021-07-28 08:56:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2021-07-29 00:15:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2021-07-29 05:13:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-07-29 09:01:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I guess this is also

Closes-Bug: #1906322

;-)'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-07-29 09:03:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I think we have traditionally made sure the system packaged version was installed so that it didn't come in and overwrite the pip installed version later."}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2021-08-10 04:53:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2021-08-10 11:56:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2 Review-Priority+1

'}, {'created': '2021-07-29 05:13:21.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Workaround for new pip 20.3 behavior"

This reverts commit 7a3a7ce876a37376fe0dca7278e41a4f46867daa and
bcd0acf6c0b5d6501e91133c3a937b3fc40f7122 and part of
f1ed7c77c50ac28cb58c9f7ed885c6a3e0a75403 which all cap our pip
installs.

Given the way the pip ecosystem does like to change things up,
tracking upstream at least generally gives us one problem at a time to
solve, rather than trying to handle massive version jumps.

The new dependency resolver included some changes that disallow
setting URL's like "file:///path/to/project#egg=project" in
constraints.  Apparently the fact it used to work was an accident of
the requires/constraints mechanism; it does make some sense as the URL
doesn't really have a version-number.

The _setup_package_with_constraints_edit function comment highlights
what this is trying to do

 # Updates the constraints from REQUIREMENTS_DIR to reflect the
 # future installed state of this package. This ensures when we
 # install this package we get the from source version.

It seems like removing the entry from upper-requirements.txt is the
important part; adding the URL path to the on-disk version was just
something that seemed to work at the time, but isn't really necessary.
We will install the package in question which will be the latest
version (from Zuul checkout) and without the package in
upper-requirements.txt nothing will try and downgrade it.

Therefore the solution proposed here is to remove the adding of the
URL parts.

Change-Id: Ib9ba52147199a9d6d0293182d5db50c4a567d677

It seems like removing the entry from upper-requirements.txt is the
important part; adding the URL path to the on-disk version was just
something that seemed to work at the time, but isn't really necessary.
We will install the package in question which will be the latest
version (from Zuul checkout) and without the package in
upper-requirements.txt nothing will try and downgrade it.

Therefore the solution proposed here is to remove the adding of the
URL parts.

Closes-Bug: #1906322
Change-Id: Ib9ba52147199a9d6d0293182d5db50c4a567d677
'}, {'created': '2021-08-10 04:53:46.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Workaround for new pip 20.3 behavior"

This reverts commit 7a3a7ce876a37376fe0dca7278e41a4f46867daa and
bcd0acf6c0b5d6501e91133c3a937b3fc40f7122 and part of
f1ed7c77c50ac28cb58c9f7ed885c6a3e0a75403 which all cap our pip
installs.

Given the pip ecosystem can often incorporate major changes, tracking
upstream at least generally gives us one problem at a time to solve
rather than trying to handle version jumps when LTS distros update.

The new dependency resolver included some changes that disallow
setting URL's like "file:///path/to/project#egg=project" in
constraints.  Apparently the fact it used to work was an accident of
the requires/constraints mechanism; it does make some sense as the URL
doesn't really have a version-number that the resolver can put in an
ordering graph.

The _setup_package_with_constraints_edit function comment highlights
what this is trying to do

 # Updates the constraints from REQUIREMENTS_DIR to reflect the
 # future installed state of this package. This ensures when we
 # install this package we get the from source version.

In other words; if constraints has "foo==1.2.3" and Zuul has checked
out "foo" for testing, we have to make sure pip doesn't choose version
1.2.3 from pypi.

It seems like removing the entry from upper-requirements.txt is the
important part; adding the URL path to the on-disk version was just
something that seemed to work at the time, but isn't really necessary.
We will install the package in question which will be the latest
version (from Zuul checkout) and without the package in
upper-requirements.txt nothing will try and downgrade it.

Therefore the solution proposed here is to remove the adding of the
URL parts.

This allows us to uncap pip and restore testing with the new
dependency resolver.

Closes-Bug: #1906322
Change-Id: Ib9ba52147199a9d6d0293182d5db50c4a567d677
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Workaround for new pip 20.3 behavior"

This reverts commit 7a3a7ce876a37376fe0dca7278e41a4f46867daa and
bcd0acf6c0b5d6501e91133c3a937b3fc40f7122 and part of
f1ed7c77c50ac28cb58c9f7ed885c6a3e0a75403 which all cap our pip
installs.

Given the pip ecosystem can often incorporate major changes, tracking
upstream at least generally gives us one problem at a time to solve
rather than trying to handle version jumps when LTS distros update.

The new dependency resolver included some changes that disallow
setting URL's like "file:///path/to/project#egg=project" in
constraints.  Apparently the fact it used to work was an accident of
the requires/constraints mechanism; it does make some sense as the URL
doesn't really have a version-number that the resolver can put in an
ordering graph.

The _setup_package_with_constraints_edit function comment highlights
what this is trying to do

 # Updates the constraints from REQUIREMENTS_DIR to reflect the
 # future installed state of this package. This ensures when we
 # install this package we get the from source version.

In other words; if constraints has "foo==1.2.3" and Zuul has checked
out "foo" for testing, we have to make sure pip doesn't choose version
1.2.3 from pypi.

It seems like removing the entry from upper-requirements.txt is the
important part; adding the URL path to the on-disk version was just
something that seemed to work at the time, but isn't really necessary.
We will install the package in question which will be the latest
version (from Zuul checkout) and without the package in
upper-requirements.txt nothing will try and downgrade it.

Therefore the solution proposed here is to remove the adding of the
URL parts.

This allows us to uncap pip and restore testing with the new
dependency resolver.

Closes-Bug: #1906322
Change-Id: Ib9ba52147199a9d6d0293182d5db50c4a567d677

This patch extends the gatekeeper to allow the trace json results to be
stored in either a path on disk or a container in swift (default
.trace/store)

If storing in Swift to object will be the txid and optionally an expiry
can be set which will set X-Delete-After.

commit_message:
WIP: Trace: Add the ability to store in swift

This patch extends the gatekeeper to allow the trace json results to be
stored in either a path on disk or a container in swift (default
.trace/store)

If storing in Swift to object will be the txid and optionally an expiry
can be set which will set X-Delete-After.

This could be moved into it's own trace middleware, but then we'd never
be able to get info out of gatekeeper. So :shrug:

Change-Id: I4371324691e9aa607caa74822c7211daf511f240

- Name now includes the date (this is optional but on by default).
- It now also uses an OrderedDict so the middlewares are ordered in
  visited order. (so can now probably from the call_stack)

Unfortuantly pythong -m json.tool will convert to a normal dict so ends
up sorting alphabetically, so if you want to view on the commandline use
jq.

Might merge this patch into a parent at some point.

Change-Id: Ic4e4b4fb578f75fae88129df28b0f9925f2ea507
'}]
commit_message:
trace: Added some SRE suggestions

- Name now includes the date (this is optional but on by default).
- It now also uses an OrderedDict so the middlewares are ordered in
  visited order. (so can now probably from the call_stack)

Unfortuantly pythong -m json.tool will convert to a normal dict so ends
up sorting alphabetically, so if you want to view on the commandline use
jq.

Might merge this patch into a parent at some point.

Change-Id: Ic4e4b4fb578f75fae88129df28b0f9925f2ea507

commit_message:
fix requirements python supported minimal version

Some recent rules have been added to openstack/requirements
concerning:
- oslo.utils
- oslo.i18n
- oslotest
- PrettyTable
- reno

According to your supported runtimes these changes define the python
version for these requirements to fix CI jobs [1].

[1]https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/5335add6109d4665aa8466502f2840bf

Change-Id: Id1794ccc00dfb73581ce0ba54598644bf495097f

subject: Remove the unused coding style modules
messages:
[{'account_id': 32029, 'date': '2020-10-27 03:47:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2020-11-25 15:23:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2020-11-29 12:20:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 32238, 'date': '2020-12-01 07:23:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2021-02-10 02:03:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I still see many linter related modules in lower-constraints.txt.

The second paragraph of the commit message says "python modules related to coding style checks (...) are dropped from lower-constraints.txt". This approach is adopted in various OpenStack projects, so it is okay. However, you just dropped mccabe. You need to drop pylint, bashate, pyflakes, .....'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-08-10 08:19:03.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+2 by Slawek Kaplonski <skaplons@redhat.com>
'}, {'account_id': 32029, 'date': '2021-08-16 02:14:46.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-27 03:47:02.000000000', 'message': 'Remove the unused coding style modules

Python modules related to coding style checks (listed in blacklist.txt in
openstack/requirements repo) are dropped from lower-constraints.txt
they are not needed during installation.

Change-Id: I80a42d37b20d37c4d4fdd8d826a205f9627f7290
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the unused coding style modules

Python modules related to coding style checks (listed in blacklist.txt in
openstack/requirements repo) are dropped from lower-constraints.txt
they are not needed during installation.

Change-Id: I80a42d37b20d37c4d4fdd8d826a205f9627f7290

thanks for your patch.
I didn't see any invocation of "skip_checks" function, can you elaborate where this function will be called.'}, {'account_id': 31455, 'date': '2021-06-09 08:24:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25738, 'date': '2021-06-09 08:52:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

i didn't see any invocation, the changes are all function definition."}, {'account_id': 31455, 'date': '2021-06-09 09:05:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> i didn't see any invocation, the changes are all function definition.

Thanks for your review.

When tempest is executed, it will first determine whether to skip the test, and each test case inherits this method.

please see: https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/branch/master/tempest/test.py#L158"}, {'account_id': 25738, 'date': '2021-07-08 06:29:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

thansk for your explanation, lgtm'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2021-08-16 01:01:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add skip_checks

When executing cyborg test cases, cyborg support is required.

Change-Id: I7a93d015caa147629df013f5c1da4dcf320fef28

Remove periodic docker publish job

Has been decided that we no longer need to publish docker image base on train every day

Change-Id: I8f09022c93cfb2c0ad040e8ea348a4e485b9f247

commit_message:
Remove periodic docker publish job

Has been decided that we no longer need to publish docker image base on train every day

Change-Id: Ib9ba48a8d451f9d63f790f4c7f981e7bba803d53

commit_message:
[SVF]: Fix Enable Replication for Storwize_V5000E

[Spectrum Virtualize Family] Added replication license support for
V5000E storage type.

Closes-Bug: #1938212

Change-Id: I5e4ea593952d9068128627bbaaf1261989eb72ce

[{'account_id': 19350, 'date': '2015-11-20 12:15:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2015-11-20 12:15:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-11-20 12:21:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

commit_message:
[WIP] Dedicated tunnel for carrying mirrored traffic

This change introduces our proposal that create a dedicated
tunnel for carrying mirrored traffic between hosts.
Link:https://wiki.openstack.org/w/images/7/78/TrafficIsolation_20151116-01.pdf

Change-Id: Ia9a3d4e2156f1e59289540b8ce4f7a414721260d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-11 04:31:30.000000000', 'message': 'Enable Quality of Service (QoS) of the mirror traffic

This patch enables QoS of the mirror traffic for TaaS.
You can create tap-flow by specifying a qos policy.

neutron tap-flow-create --port SOURCE_PORT --tap-service TAP_SERVICE
                        --direction DIRECTION --qos-policy QOS_POLICY

The bandwidth of this mirror traffic is controlled according to the
policy. In this implementation, only RULE_TYPE_BANDWIDTH_LIMIT is
supported.

Change-Id: I648e4503feba972c2d36521c60740af836ebef46
'}]
commit_message:
Enable Quality of Service (QoS) of the mirror traffic

This patch enables QoS of the mirror traffic for TaaS.
You can create tap-flow by specifying a qos policy.

neutron tap-flow-create --port SOURCE_PORT --tap-service TAP_SERVICE
                        --direction DIRECTION --qos-policy QOS_POLICY

The bandwidth of this mirror traffic is controlled according to the
policy. In this implementation, only RULE_TYPE_BANDWIDTH_LIMIT is
supported.

Change-Id: I648e4503feba972c2d36521c60740af836ebef46

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

It works for updating both the port associated to the TapService
and the port associated to the TapFlow.

In this way, the openvswitch flows are recreated on the compute
nodes. Any attach/detach of an interface will therefore delete
the stale flows in br-int, br-tap and br-tun and recreate them.

Closes-Bug: #1802706

commit_message:
TaaS: handle update port in plugin and driver

This patch handles a port update on the controller and
propagates the change from the TaaS plugin to the TaaS driver.
It works for updating both the port associated to the TapService
and the port associated to the TapFlow.

In this way, the openvswitch flows are recreated on the compute
nodes. Any attach/detach of an interface will therefore delete
the stale flows in br-int, br-tap and br-tun and recreate them.

Closes-Bug: #1802705
Closes-Bug: #1802706

Change-Id: I2e8642c70ac1da6230f52ea5344cb92f1265da7b
Signed-off-by: Adriana Constantinescu <constantinescu33@gmail.com>

[{'account_id': 32020, 'date': '2021-05-06 08:19:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 32020, 'date': '2021-05-06 08:26:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-05-06 08:34:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I have some questions in the LP bug.

I think what you are proposing is against the goal of the sync workers because only Neutron should handle the OVN NB database.'}, {'account_id': 32020, 'date': '2021-05-06 08:44:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> 
> I have some questions in the LP bug.
> 
> I think what you are proposing is against the goal of the sync workers because only Neutron should handle the OVN NB database.

Thks for your commets.
In some scenarios, if the neutron is connected to the OVN of a third party, such as the SDN software, the SDN manufacturer can issue some ACL rules by itself, but if the neutron is synchronized with the ACL, the rules of the SDN manufacturer will be deleted. Therefore, it is possible to search only the ACL in the OVN northbound database when Neutron synchronization ACLs. For example, the PG-name in the Neutron data is used as the index for filtering and searching'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2021-05-06 09:44:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

I would like to hold this off and have a discussion about this with others in the team. As Rodolfo already stated, currently we assume that the OVN databases are only updated by Neutron.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2021-05-06 10:21:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/790012/2 : SUCCESS in 1h 53m 57s'}, {'account_id': 32020, 'date': '2021-05-06 11:14:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> > Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> > 
> > I have some questions in the LP bug.
> > 
> > I think what you are proposing is against the goal of the sync workers because only Neutron should handle the OVN NB database.
> 
> Thks for your commets.
> In some scenarios, if the neutron is connected to the OVN of a third party, such as the SDN software, the SDN manufacturer can issue some ACL rules by itself, but if the neutron is synchronized with the ACL, the rules of the SDN manufacturer will be deleted. Therefore, it is possible to search only the ACL in the OVN northbound database when Neutron synchronization ACLs. For example, the PG-name in the Neutron data is used as the index for filtering and searching

> For example, if a user issues ACL through neutron, and another user issues ACL through ovn command line or other ovn system software, the ACL of each user needs to exist and take effect. However, if neutron server restarts synchronization, ACL issued by ovn system software will be deleted. I think this is a problem. Neutron only manages ACL distributed by neutron to ovn NB datebase, Others should be ignored and the list method should not be used'}, {'account_id': 32020, 'date': '2021-05-14 01:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> 
> (2 comments)
> 
> I would like to hold this off and have a discussion about this with others in the team. As Rodolfo already stated, currently we assume that the OVN databases are only updated by Neutron.

If Openstack and k8s converged deployment，kubeovn and neutron all manage OVN NB datebases.'}, {'account_id': 32020, 'date': '2021-05-14 01:46:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2021-05-14 03:37:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2021-05-27 07:44:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

AFAIR the idea is that control plane restart/downtime should not affect data plane. Like when ovs/linuxbridge agent stops - no flows are cleaned, and similar when agent starts - it doesn't recreate flows, but just checks all needed flows are present. Thus pings should not be lost by design. If this is not correct now then it might be a regression. Or a design change.."}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-08-15 08:31:12.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-03 18:50:22.000000000', 'message': 'Migration: Disable constraint on boolean attributes

With mysql >= 8.0 ALTER TABLE operations on boolean column will
fail due to implict constrain check added to TINYINT columns.

This commit disable constraint creation as discussed in
https://github.com/sqlalchemy/alembic/issues/699

Change-Id: I8af3815056457cd1068bcf227f809c2c99d7d17a
'}]
commit_message:
Migration: Disable constraint on boolean attributes

With mysql >= 8.0 ALTER TABLE operations on boolean column will
fail due to implict constrain check added to TINYINT columns.

This commit disable constraint creation as discussed in
https://github.com/sqlalchemy/alembic/issues/699

Change-Id: I8af3815056457cd1068bcf227f809c2c99d7d17a

commit_message:
[DNM] Remove warning about session with and without enginefacade

Testing patch

With this patch I want to find all places in Neutron code where a
context is used without an explicit transaction declaration. We
should manually add them to Neutron.

Change-Id: If554c599bfcca694d3db15738d581b57be6ab04d

commit_message:
Add ipsec.secrets reload function to strongSwan driver

Currently, strongSwan driver only triggers "ipsec reload" command
when a new IPsec Site Connection configuration is received. If that
configuration uses a different PSK, it will not be picked up upon
reload called by restart() function. This change introduces a separate
reload_secrets() function which will call "ipsec rereadsecrets" before
"ipsec reload".

Closes-Bug: #1921514
Change-Id: Ia5458bbbb38b1d645547baf56ce3bb5ee2a97781
(cherry picked from commit 2297098875f24289259f12012ab5f077d6051383)

commit_message:
Use "multiprocessing.Queue" for "TestNeutronServer" related tests

Instead of using a file to log the processes status and actions,
"TestNeutronServer" now uses a "multiprocessing.Queue" that is
safer than writting a single file accross multiple processes.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/test_server.py

Change-Id: I6d04df180cd9b2d593bb99c8d22a60a3534f22a0
Closes-Bug: #1930367
(cherry picked from commit da760973be09a98a1fc07c519e74a11899cb4aa5)
(cherry picked from commit b5097c9fb233753b912ffb405bea96cf10e37ea3)

commit_message:
Read keepalived initial state in parallel to interface monitoring

The initial router state method is now a thread that is executed
in parallel with the "ip monitor" thread. If by any circumstance
this thread does not read the interface IP addresses on time, the
state of the router will be defined as "backup".

Related-Bug: #1917793

Conflicts:
    neutron/agent/l3/keepalived_state_change.py

Change-Id: If76c6ee1734f544abdd4196431351d4328ad26fd
(cherry picked from commit c1ade52fda59163510dd0959ab72c442d1d07027)

commit_message:
change the way the context is generated

use RequestContext.from_dict in oslo_context to generate context, and
add special attr timestamp, in instead of overwritting
contextBase.from_dict in ineutron_lib

Closes-bug: #1933802
Change-Id: I4e14cc298cf6f1bd0c9bf9fde78f3cdb9d7df5cc

taasrecheck'}, {'account_id': 29754, 'date': '2019-04-12 18:20:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Zuul encountered a syntax error while parsing its configuration in the
repo openstack/tap-as-a-service on branch master.  The error was:

  Unknown project openstack-infra/devstack-gate

The error appears in the following job stanza:

  job:
      name: tap-as-a-service-tempest-dsvm
      parent: legacy-dsvm-base
      run: playbooks/legacy/tempest-dsvm-tap-as-a-service/run.yaml
      post-run: playbooks/legacy/tempest-dsvm-tap-as-a-service/post.yaml
      timeout: 7800
      required-projects:
        - openstack-infra/devstack-gate
        - openstack/tap-as-a-service
        - openstack/tempest
      irrelevant-files:
        - ^(test-|)requirements.txt$
        - ^.*\.rst$
        - ^doc/.*$
        - ^neutron_taas/tests/unit/.*$

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE TEST PATCH

the newly added tempest plugin has broken the third
party ci job, this patch is basically for debugging
purposes and will use taasrecheck comment to trigger
ci not to overwhelm open infra for normal ci.

I apologize in advance for the weird patch for testing.
Change-Id: I23fded9877a0ba9be0d76daaca11cb4ac32cdd05

subject: TEST FOR CI DO NOT REVIEW

commit_message:
Move rejection of min-bw rule on non-physnet port to the ovs qos driver

The ovs qos driver only supports the min-bw rule on physnet ports.
However other (future) qos drivers may support the min-bw rule on
non-physnet ports too, therefore implementing the rejection of the
unsupported combination in the qos plugin was a bug.

This change moves the rejection from the qos plugin to the ovs qos
driver.

Change-Id: I02d77a03c411dc8ab303a7d7b53d7ea93cc9f4c6
Closes-Bug: #1861442
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/705694
Related-Bug: #1819029
(cherry picked from commit 321afc8f897c8132ddc6edd2b59285111d0d73e0)

commit_message:
context networks - add support for ports

This is awhile now that OpenStack support advance network feature
like: SR-IOV, HW-offload and co. These features require that a custom
neutron port will be created before server created, and that in server
create call to use "port-id" instead of "net-id". This change address
the need to run workloads also on advance network features, The change
will take care of it by adding to the openstack-rally "networks" context
the possibility to also create ports.

Change-Id: I956046b5c56c87ea4bd519e7871614698e524d54

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-18 10:27:13.000000000', 'message': "Move 'check-cherry-picks' test to gate, n-v check

This currently runs in the 'check' pipeline, as part of the pep8 job,
which causes otherwise perfectly valid backports to report as failing
CI. There's no reason a stable core shouldn't be encouraged to review
these patches: we simply want to prevent them *merging* before their
parent(s). Resolve this conflict by moving the check to separate voting
job in the 'gate' pipeline as well as a non-voting job in the 'check'
pipeline to catch more obvious issues.

Change-Id: Id3e4452883f6a3cf44ff58b39ded82e882e28c23
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 98b01c9a59df4912f5a162c2c52d1f00c84d24c2)
(cherry picked from commit fef0305abefbf165fecb883f03bce97f525a790a)
(cherry picked from commit b7677ae08ae151858ecb0e67039e54bb3df89700)
(cherry picked from commit 91314f7fbba312d4438fa446804f692d316512a8)
"}]
commit_message:
Move 'check-cherry-picks' test to gate, n-v check

This currently runs in the 'check' pipeline, as part of the pep8 job,
which causes otherwise perfectly valid backports to report as failing
CI. There's no reason a stable core shouldn't be encouraged to review
these patches: we simply want to prevent them *merging* before their
parent(s). Resolve this conflict by moving the check to separate voting
job in the 'gate' pipeline as well as a non-voting job in the 'check'
pipeline to catch more obvious issues.

Change-Id: Id3e4452883f6a3cf44ff58b39ded82e882e28c23
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 98b01c9a59df4912f5a162c2c52d1f00c84d24c2)
(cherry picked from commit fef0305abefbf165fecb883f03bce97f525a790a)
(cherry picked from commit b7677ae08ae151858ecb0e67039e54bb3df89700)
(cherry picked from commit 91314f7fbba312d4438fa446804f692d316512a8)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-08 16:42:01.000000000', 'message': 'Add cinder-manage command to remove file locks

This patch adds a new subgroup of commands called `util` with a single
command ``remove_locks` that takes care of deleting locks that will no
longer be used because the resources they are related to are no longer
there.

This works for volumes and snapshots and with the cinder services
running or stopped.

It gets the file locks filtering by name (must have the "cinder-" prefix
and an UUID) and then if the service is online it will discard files for
resources that are still present in the database.

Closes-Bug: #1432387
Change-Id: I2535017e112c8bcb9a2e516876f52a945e9c7da8

This patch adds a new subgroup of commands called `util` with a single
command ``remove_locks` that takes care of deleting locks that will no
longer be used because the resources they are related to are no longer
there.

This works for volumes and snapshots and with the cinder services

commit_message:
Add cinder-manage command to remove file locks

This patch adds a new subgroup of commands called `util` with a single
command ``remove_locks` that takes care of deleting locks that will no
longer be used because the resources they are related to are no longer
there.

This works for volumes and snapshots and with the cinder services
running or stopped.

It gets the file locks filtering by name (must have the "cinder-" prefix
and an UUID) and then if the service is online it will not delete file
locks for resources that are still present in the database.

Closes-Bug: #1432387
Change-Id: I2535017e112c8bcb9a2e516876f52a945e9c7da8

[{'created': '2021-08-11 16:16:46.000000000', 'message': 'Set ganesha_vip when no StoragetNFS network

is deployed.

Normally when Ganesha is deployed for CephFS through NFS,
the StorageNFS isolated network is deployed and we set
the address for ganesha_vip on that network.  But with
Standalone role the StorageNFS network is not deployed
so ganesha_vip is not set in the tripleo hieradata unless
it is provided by extra config.

Set it to net_vip_map.external in the event that it has
not been set on the StorageNFS network.  Note that external
is chosen rather than ctlplane since the VIP must be reachable
from compute instances, guest VMs, that should have no access
to the ctlplane network.

commit_message:
Set ganesha_vip when no StoragetNFS network

is deployed.

Normally when Ganesha is deployed for CephFS through NFS,
the StorageNFS isolated network is deployed and we set
the address for ganesha_vip on that network.  But with
Standalone role the StorageNFS network is not deployed
so ganesha_vip is not set in the tripleo hieradata unless
it is provided by extra config.

Set it to net_vip_map.external in the event that it has
not been set on the StorageNFS network.  Note that external
is chosen rather than ctlplane since the VIP must be reachable
from compute instances, guest VMs, that should have no access
to the ctlplane network.

Closes-Bug: #1911022
Change-Id: Ia97533c0b8b3b8498a173e1d363323dcdc77cce4
(cherry picked from commit 0aceca00e76e967ee9b5efc30da0bc3ee23acb2e)
(cherry picked from commit 520b1e1edb83d9f9e101695900667c80a4cdbc8f)
(cherry picked from commit 3ff85eb7db7636ff395ba6f2da0f6fda7b6f1a24)
(cherry picked from commit 7a527977e65595ff85c47d60a11c8feec752ef8a)

subject: When creating a client, pass the default logger
messages:
[{'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2021-03-25 14:12:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2021-03-25 18:15:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2021-03-27 13:09:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

If a logger is specified, the logger should be used.
If a logger is not specified, a keystoneauth.session logger should be used in keystoneauth.session operations.
So it should be kept as it is.'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2021-03-30 07:41:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> If a logger is not specified, a keystoneauth.session logger should be used in keystoneauth.session operations.

This is not true. If a logger is not specified, a novaclient logger should be created and used. This how it works with every other OpenStack client library, and how it worked before novaclient did this refactoring to use keystoneayth.session.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2021-04-09 01:50:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

I tried out this change with a local devstack and I think it makes sense now.

The client object we construct makes calls to the nova API and I think it is more useful to have such log messages logged under novaclient.

Comparing an example before this patch:

DEBUG:keystoneauth.session:REQ: curl -g -i -X GET http://127.0.0.1/identity -H "Accept: application/json" -H "User-Agent: python-novaclient keystoneauth1/4.3.0 python-requests/2.25.1 CPython/3.8.5"
...
DEBUG:keystoneauth.session:REQ: curl -g -i -X GET http://127.0.0.1/compute/v2.1/servers/detail -H "Accept: application/json" -H "User-Agent: python-novaclient" -H "X-Auth-Token: {SHA256}79208362548dea507eea94f28088b55a549e5724e76f693c01c142fd23c0494f" -H "X-OpenStack-Nova-API-Version: 2.1"

and after this patch:

DEBUG:keystoneauth.session:REQ: curl -g -i -X GET http://127.0.0.1/identity -H "Accept: application/json" -H "User-Agent: python-novaclient keystoneauth1/4.3.0 python-requests/2.25.1 CPython/3.8.5"
...
DEBUG:novaclient.v2.client:REQ: curl -g -i -X GET http://127.0.0.1/compute/v2.1/servers/detail -H "Accept: application/json" -H "User-Agent: python-novaclient" -H "X-Auth-Token: {SHA256}201a2ba5ffcd0feb9102d4f1f006cbc034533147ccd8b2467113b0942ec9797e" -H "X-OpenStack-Nova-API-Version: 2.1"

The latter is more clear, IMHO.'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2021-04-09 16:59:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Fair enough. Thanks, melwitt.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-14 18:22:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Could this be backported to ease with debugging on stable branches? It seems, without this fix, novaclient does not pick up the service logging config (as it picks up the level for keystoneauth which defaults to WARN). I have observed this with Masakari where turning debug on did not make novaclient log debug (before this).'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-14 18:23:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Could this be backported to ease with debugging on stable branches? It seems, without this fix, novaclient does not pick up the service logging config (as it picks up the level for keystoneauth which defaults to WARN). I have observed this with Masakari where turning debug on did not make novaclient log debug (before this).

I see this was merged as a bugfix so per policy you should be accepting so I'm therefore proposing. 😊"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-14 18:24:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

and have my +1 for good work'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-25 14:12:32.000000000', 'message': "When creating a client, pass the default logger

When a client is created without a logger, novaclient creates a
default logger, but it's then not used, because it's not passed
to the factory function. Because of that, all novaclient calls
are getting logged as 'keystoneauth.session' instead of
'novaclient.v2.client' as they should.

Closes-bug: 1921388
Change-Id: I53caceb08667eb12e27016731868e8015dd10e34
"}]
commit_message:
When creating a client, pass the default logger

When a client is created without a logger, novaclient creates a
default logger, but it's then not used, because it's not passed
to the factory function. Because of that, all novaclient calls
are getting logged as 'keystoneauth.session' instead of
'novaclient.v2.client' as they should.

Closes-bug: 1921388
Change-Id: I53caceb08667eb12e27016731868e8015dd10e34

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-14 17:33:52.000000000', 'message': 'Fix wrong section used for some driver options

Since cinder removed support for a single backend[1], volume backends
no longer load parameters from [DEFAULT] section, and it uses
the different [backend_defauts] as a common place where default
overrides are defined.

This change fixes the wrong usage of [DEFAULT] by the following volume
drivers.
 - DataCore SANsymphony Fibre Channel volume driver
 - DataCore SANsymphony iSCSI volume driver
 - Inspur InStorage MCS FC volume driver
 - Inspur InStorage iSCSI volume driver

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/453654

Closes-Bug: #1939956
Change-Id: If5d5b759632d5563487693531c104a209b4738bb
'}, {'created': '2021-08-14 17:35:47.000000000', 'message': 'Fix wrong section used for some volume driver options

Since cinder removed support for a single backend[1], volume backends
no longer load parameters from [DEFAULT] section, and it uses
the different [backend_defauts] as a common place where default
overrides are defined.

This change fixes the wrong usage of [DEFAULT] by the following volume
drivers.

commit_message:
Fix wrong section used for some volume driver options

Since cinder removed support for a single backend[1], volume backends
no longer load parameters from [DEFAULT] section, and it the different
[backend_defauts] section is used as a common place where default
overrides are defined.

This change fixes the wrong usage of [DEFAULT] by the volume drivers
for the following vendors.
 - DataCore
 - Inspur

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/453654

Closes-Bug: #1939956
Change-Id: If5d5b759632d5563487693531c104a209b4738bb

commit_message:
only wait for plugtime events in pre-live-migration

This change modifies _get_neutron_events_for_live_migration
to filter the event to just the subset that will be sent
at plug-time.

Currently neuton has a bug where by the dhcp agent
send a network-vif-plugged event during live migration after
we update the port profile with "migrating-to:"
this cause a network-vif-plugged event to be sent for
configuration where vif_plugging in nova/os-vif is a noop.

when that is corrected the current logic in nova cause the migration
to time out as its waiting for an event that will never arrive.

This change filters the set of events we wait for to just the plug
time events.

Conflicts:
    nova/compute/manager.py
    nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py

Related-Bug: #1815989
Closes-Bug: #1901707
Change-Id: Id2d8d72d30075200d2b07b847c4e5568599b0d3b
(cherry picked from commit 8b33ac064456482158b23c2a2d52f819ebb4c60e)
(cherry picked from commit ef348c4eb3379189f290217c9351157b1ebf0adb)
(cherry picked from commit d9c833d5a404dfa206e08c97543e80cb613b3f0b)

commit_message:
Add missing font for PDF doc generation and fix lower constraints

openstack-tox-docs job started to fail with the following error:

! LaTeX Error: File `tgtermes.sty' not found.

This patch adds the required font package to bindep doc profile.

With the new pip resolver (introduced in pip 20.3) the constraints
checking is now working better, thus reveals multiple constrain
conflicts. This patch also fixes those problems.

Change-Id: Ia57b4ce4aa996e61346eae0f4b6a6599f8555652
(cherry picked from commit d36954704d1e327686596024aeb4c21a370b4d45)
(cherry picked from commit 0720482ce56da5233c6a429b38dd49c88dc09537)

[{'created': '2021-05-03 08:28:49.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: If1d10f229112d1a5a115cf1d2fc964f8095c3474

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: If1d10f229112d1a5a115cf1d2fc964f8095c3474

subject: Allow customization of rabbitmq prometheus tcp port
messages:
[{'account_id': 32140, 'date': '2020-06-25 23:50:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2020-06-25 23:50:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

Workflow Guide: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-06-26 19:40:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I like the change in general, very straightforward. I'm just worried that putting prometheus vars in config might be confusing and potentially break if users rebuild rmq image without prometheus. Could we condition this part of config on prometheus being enabled? Possibly with another variable.

That said, it might be wise that we think about customizations for this file. Maybe we could get away with a (possibly modified) ini parser. The syntax looks quite similar. We could also just merge two text files."}, {'account_id': 32140, 'date': '2020-07-21 15:28:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 32140, 'date': '2020-07-21 15:46:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Radoslaw,

Thanks for the comments. I have added a configuration flag to make configuration of promehtheus port optoinal in rabbitmq.conf:

rabbitmq_configure_prometheus_port: "{{ enable_outward_rabbitmq | bool }}"

It is enabled by default if 'enable_outward_rabbitmq: "yes"'. Why? because prometheus plugin is enabled by default in rabbitmq image and I think the port should be automatically customized if outward rabbitmq is started along side with regular rabbitmq.

If someone uses a rabbitmq image without prometheus plugin, they can disable the configuration by setting:

rabbitmq_configure_prometheus_port: "no"'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-07-22 11:21:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hmm, so prometheus got enabled by default? Arr, I thought it needed some config to run. Sounds like a bug.'}, {'account_id': 27336, 'date': '2020-08-07 11:44:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Backport-Candidate+1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-03-12 16:16:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-03-12 16:17:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-03-15 10:35:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Note: I haven't tested this, only squashed it with the other patch, as requested by Radek."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-03-15 10:36:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4:
> 
> Note: I haven't tested this, only squashed it with the other patch, as requested by Radek.

To be clear, I'm not picking this up, as I realised the RMQ metrics are exposed by default and I don't use murano."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-13 12:01:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

We are likely going to deprecate outward_rabbitmq with murano going away http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-August/024120.html'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-14 08:22:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4:
> 
> We are likely going to deprecate outward_rabbitmq with murano going away http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-August/024120.html

In the other patch [1], Lin has pointed out they are using outward_rabbitmq with notifications so we might want to consider keeping this extra functionality for that case (just needs some documentation).

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/801747'}]

> Patch Set 2:

> This patch looks good, thanks, but in the end I don't understand the difference between `remote-sink` and `meter-sink`. It seems to be the exact same feature twice with a different name?

The user tried to use remote-sink for what they were doing, and that doesn't work for telegraf. They had to use meter_sink by manually updating the file. Hence the bug and review, so that this can be automated via a config flag.

Historically pipeline-yaml allowed users to replace the whole file, and as that doesn't work for Mitaka and above, this couldn't be utilised."}, {'account_id': 9247, 'date': '2021-08-11 10:32:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Add meter-sink as an option

If the user wants to add a meter-sink to the pipeline.yaml
at the moment this cannot be done. Previously, pipeline-yaml
config option was allowed and could replace the whole config.

This will now allow to also add meter-sink as an option to
the event_pipeline.yaml, and allow a new source of collecting
all meters, and pushing to the value of meter-sink URLs.

Closes-Bug: 1938807
Change-Id: If6cd82e4153b29c1d8fdb6df150d0d4bb11d4e49

subject: Nova cell setup cron frequency change
messages: [{'account_id': 28275, 'date': '2021-08-13 22:15:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28275, 'date': '2021-08-13 22:17:46.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nNot required upstream.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-13 22:15:47.000000000', 'message': 'Nova cell setup cron frequency change

This changes the cell setup cron to run more frequently, as it's
been found that the Nova bootstrap job can get stuck waiting for
all hypervisors to show up (even when computes are up and running).
Cell setup runs during the initial deployment and then at the top
of each hour. If timing is bad, the initial cell setup job may run
prior all compute's services being up and not "register" them in the
hypervisor list. The deployment is then forced, because of the bootstrap
job, to wait until the top of the next hour for cell setup for run
again, which them registers the rest in the hypervisor list. The cell
setup job does have an init container, but it only checks that a single
compute service is "up" before proceeding with the initial
"discover_hosts". Other options to remedy this have been considered,
but none are very clean and this is likely the simplest/most expedient
workaround.

Change-Id: If2a25e2e073498ba0582a305793f492e379a1953
'}]
commit_message:
Nova cell setup cron frequency change

This changes the cell setup cron to run more frequently, as it's
been found that the Nova bootstrap job can get stuck waiting for
all hypervisors to show up (even when computes are up and running).
Cell setup runs during the initial deployment and then at the top
of each hour. If timing is bad, the initial cell setup job may run
prior all compute's services being up and not "register" them in the
hypervisor list. The deployment is then forced, because of the bootstrap
job, to wait until the top of the next hour for cell setup for run
again, which them registers the rest in the hypervisor list. The cell
setup job does have an init container, but it only checks that a single
compute service is "up" before proceeding with the initial
"discover_hosts". Other options to remedy this have been considered,
but none are very clean and this is likely the simplest/most expedient
workaround.

Change-Id: If2a25e2e073498ba0582a305793f492e379a1953

I don't yet quite understand the use-case for putting this in a config file

giving Tim the benifit of the doubt tho I still think we could simplify:

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/swift/+/803985

... but maybe I'm missing something else important"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-08-09 21:29:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

Basically, I want to address https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/swift/+/803536/1/swift/common/internal_client.py#880 -- I'm going to spawn a new proxy-server instance and route InternalClient calls through *that*, so I need a way to keep the (separate process!) proxy from changing things. I *know* 1space relies on being able to read null-namespace and sysmeta."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-08-13 19:36:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

The plumbing for a CLI option wasn't too bad: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/swift/+/804544

I still find the config option more natural, but maybe in light of the prior art, CLI-only would be more palatable..."}]

commit_message:
Create pike-eol tag for networking-bgpvpn and networking-bagpipe

CI for those projects in stable/pike is broken e.g. because it requires
Horizon which is already EOL in Pike.
Last patches were merged in those repositories around 2019.

Change-Id: I856ac86a1ca6ef1476e7bb29427eac109b2d1643

[{'created': '2021-08-11 08:01:53.000000000', 'message': "Make neutron-ovs-tempest-dvr-ha-multinode-full voting

DVR-HA check job has become pretty stable after latest DVR fix [1].
Let's make it voting to prevent further DVR-HA regressions.

commit_message:
Make neutron-ovs-tempest-dvr-ha-multinode-full voting

DVR-HA check job has become pretty stable after latest DVR fix [1].
Let's make it voting to prevent further DVR-HA regressions.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/803211

Change-Id: Ieac9a8bf9f01a18069fc419cf52ca7a0624fec32

Authorization errors when connecting
to nova/glance/neutron/cinder can be raised as
BadConfigurationExceptions in the logs. We shouldn't
be raising exceptions derived from the service client
libraries.

Change-Id: I2d47dbb1251dfa8d529f813724fb7fd97d7d3a0b
Closes-Bug: #1921927
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Handle service client authorization errors

Authorization errors when connecting
to nova/glance/neutron/cinder can be raised as
BadConfigurationExceptions in the logs. We shouldn't
be raising exceptions derived from the service client
libraries.

Change-Id: I2d47dbb1251dfa8d529f813724fb7fd97d7d3a0b
Closes-Bug: #1921927
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 04e06968fd7990adac9eb92a885af557a8acc772)

commit_message:
Use assertCountEqual instead of assertItemsEqual

The assertItemsEqual method has been removed in Python 3.3 [1] but
it was kept alive by unittest2, imported by testtools. For better
compatibility, change to assertCountEqual.

[1] https://bugs.python.org/issue17866

Change-Id: Ia0ea0235784badbb43faeb15926f9dd978cb7b75

subject: Replace deprecated inspect.getargspec
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-13 08:51:13.000000000', 'message': 'Replace deprecated inspect.getargspec

inspect.getargspec was deprecated since Python 3.0 and
inspect.getfullargspec is its replacement with correct handling of
function annotations and keyword-only parameters[1].

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/inspect.html#inspect.getargspec

Change-Id: Ib3c07b53cb1f766c58975106391c839eada3bd5f
'}]
commit_message:
Replace deprecated inspect.getargspec

inspect.getargspec was deprecated since Python 3.0 and
inspect.getfullargspec is its replacement with correct handling of
function annotations and keyword-only parameters[1].

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/inspect.html#inspect.getargspec

Change-Id: Ib3c07b53cb1f766c58975106391c839eada3bd5f

Adjust molecule jobs for Ansible 2.11

Add community.crypto collection to testing of tripleo-transfer role,
since it uses openssh_keypair module.

subject: setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-13 09:29:58.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ia8b8754bab37b7a6b1d87bd45d6fe72bb303ffad

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ia8b8754bab37b7a6b1d87bd45d6fe72bb303ffad

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-10 15:06:46.000000000', 'message': 'OVN DBs clustering

We introduce support for running both the NB and SB OVN databases in
clustered mode. This OVN DBs clustered mode is based on OVNs own
clustering protocol and does not rely on pacemaker.

Clustering the two OVN databases increases reliability. The cluster
works in active-active mode and has the potential to be more
resilient and performant.

See
https://docs.openvswitch.org/en/latest/ref/ovsdb.7/#clustered-database-service-model
for more information.

For backport simplicity we also add I50cf3b7d79d8cd139ae514438e147df73901a366
("Fix typo in ovn-dbs-cluster northd kolla config file") which
is a cherry-pick + squash of commit 1115698c14788555510edbe1760bbc9cc9110dff,
so we avoid ovn_northd connecting only to the local db via unix socket.

Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>

commit_message:
OVN DBs clustering

We introduce support for running both the NB and SB OVN databases in
clustered mode. This OVN DBs clustered mode is based on OVNs own
clustering protocol and does not rely on pacemaker.

Clustering the two OVN databases increases reliability. The cluster
works in active-active mode and has the potential to be more
resilient and performant.

See
https://docs.openvswitch.org/en/latest/ref/ovsdb.7/#clustered-database-service-model
for more information.

For backport simplicity we also add I50cf3b7d79d8cd139ae514438e147df73901a366
("Fix typo in ovn-dbs-cluster northd kolla config file") which
is a cherry-pick + squash of commit 1115698c14788555510edbe1760bbc9cc9110dff,
so we avoid ovn_northd connecting only to the local db via unix socket.

Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>

Related-Bug: #1931133
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/776961
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/795763

NB: Some changes for this victoria backport are needed:
- Readd DefaultPasswords:
- go back to the old way of doing TLS (i.e. no system-roles.certificate)
- template version back to rocky
- Set tripleo_container_manage_systemd_order: false (I believe it was a
  mistake to start with and we removed it in master as well)

Change-Id: I59bfe69dbb5f3d525ac6f6d655577d24036328c0
(cherry picked from commit baf4a16149d2a31ccb331cc96b89871e71c00734)
(cherry picked from commit 15433f131ceee8e8df6e8ca60b0703467fbbf310)

commit_message:
Changed minversion in tox to 3.18.0

The patch bumps min version of tox to 3.18.0 in order to
replace tox's whitelist_externals by allowlist_externals option:
https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst#v3180-2020-07-23

Change-Id: Iaeb555162a7b527b6f482a72ca327b851ef61f3d

commit_message:
Add tripleo_ovn_cluster role

We introduce support for running both the NB and SB OVN databases in
clustered mode. This OVN DBs clustered mode is based on OVN's own
clustering protocol and does not rely on pacemaker.

THT service: https://review.opendev.org/775444

Co-Authored-By: Michele Baldessari <michele@acksyn.org>
Change-Id: I5baa697ae351d10e53f7cf70641fe0eecede507f

commit_message:
libvirt: Enable 'vmcoreinfo' feature by default

The 'vmcoreinfo' feature flag enables the vmcoreinfo device, which will
"create a fw_cfg entry for a guest to store dump details, necessary to
process kernel dump with KASLR enabled and providing additional kernel
details." [1] It's supported since libvirt 3.10 and QEMU 2.11, both of
which are lower than our minimum versions.

[1] https://github.com/libvirt/libvirt/commit/7e4177a35b

Change-Id: I66a8e94f6d04cc89785646aa9c3e138f22a51f60
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-01 06:37:34.000000000', 'message': "reconstructor: add skip_partition_count option

After a rebalance, the next run on of the constructor may find frags missing
from the partition that was moved. This means everytime we go rebuild a
fragment we'll end up finding the missing fragment on the old primary.
In this circumstance it seems useless to continue looking for existing
frags. It would be better to track the number of fragements have been
found on a partition and if we get to a certain number, short circut and
skip that partition.

That's what this patch does. It adds a `skip_partition_count` option,
defaulting to 0 (disabled), which when a partition reaches above this
count we start raising SsyncAbortDatafile's for that partition.
Thereby leaving it to the handoff to push its data to the new location.

Change-Id: I527f398ad0c8c844f90cf91b9b151e66a9341f9e

commit_message:
reconstructor: add skip_partition_count option

After a rebalance, the next run on of the constructor may find frags missing
from the partition that was moved. This means everytime we go rebuild a
fragment we'll end up finding the missing fragment on the old primary.
In this circumstance it seems useless to continue looking for existing
frags. It would be better to track the number of fragements have been
found on a partition and if we get to a certain number, short circut and
skip that partition.

That's what this patch does. It adds a `skip_partition_count` option,
defaulting to 0 (disabled), which when a partition reaches above this
count we start raising SsyncAbortDatafile's for that partition.
Thereby leaving it to the handoff to push its data to the new location.

Change-Id: I527f398ad0c8c844f90cf91b9b151e66a9341f9e

commit_message:
Trivial fix nova's healthchecks

Kolla-ansible upgrade task is calling different
handlers as deploy task and these handlers are
missing healthcheck key. This patch is fixing
this.

Closes-Bug: #1939679
Change-Id: Id83d20bfd89c27ccf70a3a79938f428cdb5d40fc

Thanks for answering to my comments, Haixin!

Also, in my understanding, since you're adding limit and offset to share snapthot queries, I'd say that with the pagination being performed in the database layer, you would be also partly solving this [1] bug, right? If so, I do not know if we should add a tag regarding that other bug in the commit message or if the changes should be splitted and each one of them address single items.

I guess we need other reviewers opinion on what function we should keep and the above question I've added for you. Let's see what they think :)

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/manila/+bug/1831094"}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2020-09-23 08:51:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

hi,Carlos Eduardo.
thanks for your review.
in manila/db/sqlalchemy/utils.py，
In this file, I've added functions specifically for paging，To speed up the query, put the limit and offset parameters in the database layer and call the paging function，
In my opinion, in addition to these two parameters, including some other query conditions, such as name, description, ID number, etc., all need to be moved to the database layer to complete the query, and the results of the query should be used for paging. For this problem, I think patch can be mentioned separately.Each patch solves one problem"}, {'account_id': 29632, 'date': '2020-09-23 23:26:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> 
> I was wondering if the best thing to do is to split this fix into two changes. We can have more people to weigh here...

hi, Carlos Eduardo! Thanks for your review.
in this patch include two fix, one is add gendric fuzzy match logic, another is applied fuzzy matching logic to share snapshot query. I don't think it's necessary to separate the two,Because doing so helps to make it easier for other contributors to apply the matching logic to other queryable items.This patch can be used as an application case. share type list, share server list, share network list can also use this logic for other contributors."}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2021-03-20 03:36:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2021-03-20 03:37:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

commit_message:
Add generic fuzzy matching logic to the database layer

share snap list, Fuzzy query by name or description is supported, but
the current implementation is first get all the shares, then In the API
layer, the for loop is used to achieve fuzzy matching, if the num of
shares is big,
It will seriously affect the speed of fuzzy matching.Therefore, we
should let the database do the matching to speed up the query.
Moving the pagination params (limit, offset, sorting) to the database
layer for snapshot list, to optimize query speed.

Closes-Bug:#1881865
Partial-Bug:#1831094

Change-Id: I283e78c9e7c2dd626d94cf6c1b01d4e2f9ae8097

[{'created': '2021-08-12 09:04:01.000000000', 'message': 'ValueError shen passing a string representation of a float into int

In the QemuImgInfo class, the magnitude could be a string representation
of a float by the code:
    magnitude = format(float(real_size.group(1)), '.of')
This leads to "ValueError: invalid literal for int()..."

Closes-Bug: #1939468
Change-Id: Ide2ea74f1af91411817de9ab5d777786618355e5

commit_message:
ValueError shen passing a string representation of a float into int

In the QemuImgInfo class, the magnitude could be a string representation
of a float, which would leads to "ValueError: invalid literal for int()..."

Closes-Bug: #1939468
Change-Id: Ide2ea74f1af91411817de9ab5d777786618355e5

commit_message:
Remove redhat-release package from UBI8 image

Also install centos*release package when tcib_distro
is centos.

*release packages are protected by dnf, so used
rpm commands to remove.

Disable upgrades pipeline to get this fix in.

(cherry picked from commit 906265c433003886d87ac29d9daf68eccb69a40c)

Closes-Bug: #1939674
Change-Id: I5467a5faa36aa1359ff9b8135a512566dff12a79

commit_message:
Remove redhat-release package from UBI8 image

Also install centos*release package when tcib_distro
is centos.

*release packages are protected by dnf, so used
rpm commands to remove.

Disable upgrades pipeline to get this fix in.

(cherry picked from commit a7513bc0b970d8317f8b598a967c7c61c4ed1b6e)
(cherry picked from commit 963c55bd4423e47eb243fdd746ff484dc3a4d6f2)
(cherry picked from commit 906265c433003886d87ac29d9daf68eccb69a40c)

Closes-Bug: #1939674
Change-Id: I5467a5faa36aa1359ff9b8135a512566dff12a79

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Fix errant key

The author of change I08c014e10c3fc54046930ea8be2b13775428e51b fat
fingered the replacement of 'python-requires' with 'python_requires'
resulting in the following warning:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'python-r_quires' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'python_r_quires' instead

Not sure how setuptools was still identifying but resolve it
nonetheless.

Related-Bug: #1939716

Change-Id: I293919d6dc93bf221eae9109fd4a658d332bdca8
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Resolve compatibility with oslo.db future

Change I468048c01455d9dfe12004736c181806dc218e37 in oslo.db means that
the table returned from 'oslo_db.utils.get_table' is no longer bound to
a 'Connection' or 'Engine'. Get out ahead of this breaking change by
creating out own 'Connection' as part of the test. Note that we use
'Connection.execute' instead of 'Engine.execute' as the latter is
deprecated in SQLAlchemy 1.4 for removal in 2.0.

Related-Bug: #1939716

Change-Id: I957d2a9d7c875120bed0022ce1e953b2ec9f97cd
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Move member policy checks to API layer

This change enforce member policy checks in API layer and disables
read-only checks at auth layer and disables policy layer as well.

This patch also changes default RBAC policy defined for 'get_member',
'get_members' and 'modify_member'.

Partially implements: blueprint policy-refactor

Change-Id: If425d6263854e3bdb505fbdcb4eecf2e9d98d725

messages: [{'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2021-08-11 05:01:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2021-08-12 05:27:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-12 12:57:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-12 17:04:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-11 05:01:19.000000000', 'message': "Simplify pip install

The uninstall here has been around since
Ibb4b42119dc2e51577c77bbbbffb110863e5324d.  At the time, there might
have been conflicts between packaged and installed pip.  We don't need
it today; get-pip.py keeps itself separate enough in /usr/local on all
platforms.  Thus we can also remove the suse/centos special-casing.

python3-pip is in the RPM list so we don't need to
re-install for Fedora.

Add a note on why we are over-installing pip.

Remove some old setuptools workarounds that are commented out.

Change-Id: Ie3cb81a8ff71cf4b81e23831c380f83b0381de71
"}]
commit_message:
Simplify pip install

The uninstall here has been around since
Ibb4b42119dc2e51577c77bbbbffb110863e5324d.  At the time, there might
have been conflicts between packaged and installed pip.  We don't need
it today; get-pip.py keeps itself separate enough in /usr/local on all
platforms.  Thus we can also remove the suse/centos special-casing.

python3-pip is in the RPM list so we don't need to
re-install for Fedora.

Add a note on why we are over-installing pip.

Remove some old setuptools workarounds that are commented out.

Change-Id: Ie3cb81a8ff71cf4b81e23831c380f83b0381de71

commit_message:
Remove rehdat-release package from UBI8 image

Also install centos*release package when tcib_distro
is centos.

*release packages are protected by dnf, so used
rpm commands to remove.

Disable upgrades pipeline to get this fix in.
Closes-Bug: #1939674
Change-Id: I5467a5faa36aa1359ff9b8135a512566dff12a79

Need to verify that https://review.opendev.org/#/c/757936/ hits the correct code path.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-10-30 00:49:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: -Workflow

You can see that cinder tries to clone a volume from the one containing the image here:

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/a1139effc6604079a554f7c37af6b929/log/controller/logs/screen-c-vol.txt#1987-1988

It can't find the volume containing the image because Cinder doesn't understand the Images v2.11 cinder URL format, which is bug https://launchpad.net/bugs/1898075

(The test doesn't fail because Cinder falls back to downloading the image from Glance and storing it in the Cinder image cache, and thus can successfully create the volume after all.  I'll have to figure out a new test for this particular issue (I was just hijacking a test for something else that created the kind of Glance image that triggers the cinder optimized workflow)."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-11-15 13:00:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Support optimized cinder backend for glance

When Glance is configured with a cinder glance_store, Cinder can be
configured to allow cloning of image data directly in the backend
instead of transferring data through Glance.  Expose these
configuration options in devstack to facilitate testing this feature.

Adds:
- CINDER_ALLOWED_DIRECT_URL_SCHEMES
- GLANCE_SHOW_DIRECT_URL
- GLANCE_SHOW_MULTIPLE_LOCATIONS

Change-Id: Iee619b443088fd77cf7b1a48563203bdf4a93a39

commit_message:
Handle AggregateNotFound when deleting aggregate

If an error occurs during lease create and an aggregate isn't created,
an exception will be raised in cleanup_resources when trying to delete
the missing aggregate. Handle this gracefully and continue.

Closes-Bug: #1938241

Change-Id: I866bc7c369fb390f8c9204e36c06fadea17f6dd5

commit_message:
Revert "Disable airship citylcoud nodepool provider"

This reverts commit fab58f375a81dddb846406dbcadaeeb777c68e75.

It is reported that city network has fixed the glance issues and we can
reenable this cloud region.

Devstack team: the S3 backup driver was merged in cinder in wallaby, based on the CI running using 'depends-on' for the devstack patch.  As Luigi astutely noted, although the devstack work has merged into master (xena development), it's not present in stable/wallaby, which prevents us from running CI for the s3 backup driver in stable/wallaby.  It's a low risk change that's isolated to the c-bak service, and I think it meets the usual backport criteria."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-08-12 14:43:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-08 17:03:38.000000000', 'message': "Configure Cinder backup driver

This patch adds a new environment variable, CINDER_BACKUP_DRIVER for
configuring cinder backup driver used when c-bak service is enabled.
This gets cinder backup driver configurable with a similar pattern to
cinder backends. Although the current configurable backup drivers don't
need cleanup functions, the interface for cleanup is prepared for the
future.

The following backup drivers can be configured:
  swift:
  This is the default backup driver.
  ceph:
  This already can be configured if ceph backend driver is enabled. For
  backward compatibility, ceph backup driver is used if ceph backend
  driver is enabled and no backup driver is specified.
  s3_swift:
  The s3 backup driver gets configurable with this patch. By specifying
  's3_swift', the driver is configured for swift s3api.

In the future, lib/cinder_backups/s3 should be created separatedly for
external S3 compatible storage. This file will just set given parameters
such as a URL and credentials.

Change-Id: I356c224d938e1aa59c8589387a03682b3ec6e23d
(cherry picked from commit 01a84d2d03cd871fb8734d5fdc9d149b9487e3e4)
"}]
commit_message:
Configure Cinder backup driver

This patch adds a new environment variable, CINDER_BACKUP_DRIVER for
configuring cinder backup driver used when c-bak service is enabled.
This gets cinder backup driver configurable with a similar pattern to
cinder backends. Although the current configurable backup drivers don't
need cleanup functions, the interface for cleanup is prepared for the
future.

The following backup drivers can be configured:
  swift:
  This is the default backup driver.
  ceph:
  This already can be configured if ceph backend driver is enabled. For
  backward compatibility, ceph backup driver is used if ceph backend
  driver is enabled and no backup driver is specified.
  s3_swift:
  The s3 backup driver gets configurable with this patch. By specifying
  's3_swift', the driver is configured for swift s3api.

In the future, lib/cinder_backups/s3 should be created separatedly for
external S3 compatible storage. This file will just set given parameters
such as a URL and credentials.

Change-Id: I356c224d938e1aa59c8589387a03682b3ec6e23d
(cherry picked from commit 01a84d2d03cd871fb8734d5fdc9d149b9487e3e4)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-09 17:59:05.000000000', 'message': "Make frr ACLs compatible with both frr 7.5 and 8.0

While testing frr, it seems that one of our ACLs is not accepted by frr 8.0:

    2021/08/09 14:18:23 BGP: [JMR52-70SM0][EC 100663332] error
      processing configuration change: error [validation] event [validate]
      operation [modify] xpath [/frr-filter:lib/prefix-list[type='ipv4'][name='only-default-host-prefixes']/entry[sequence='5']/ipv4-prefix]
      message: duplicated prefix list value: 0.0.0.0/0

This is because ip prefix-list only-default-host-prefixes permit
0.0.0.0/0 seems to not be parsed by frr 8.0 any longer. Potentially due
to https://github.com/FRRouting/frr/commit/bf79e923167c79b2e813b7e7efda7211949d6378

While we think this is an frr bug (our frr version config is explicitly
set to 7.0) and we'll chase upstream on this, let's make this config
compatible with both frr versions.

Change-Id: Ia3922804fdffb49c06ef9b3497a52a9a8f1ccb64
Closes-Bug: #1939332
"}]
commit_message:
Make frr ACLs compatible with both frr 7.5 and 8.0

While testing frr, it seems that one of our ACLs is not accepted by frr 8.0:

    2021/08/09 14:18:23 BGP: [JMR52-70SM0][EC 100663332] error
      processing configuration change: error [validation] event [validate]
      operation [modify] xpath [/frr-filter:lib/prefix-list[type='ipv4'][name='only-default-host-prefixes']/entry[sequence='5']/ipv4-prefix]
      message: duplicated prefix list value: 0.0.0.0/0

This is because ip prefix-list only-default-host-prefixes permit
0.0.0.0/0 seems to not be parsed by frr 8.0 any longer. Potentially due
to https://github.com/FRRouting/frr/commit/bf79e923167c79b2e813b7e7efda7211949d6378

While we think this is an frr bug (our frr version config is explicitly
set to 7.0) and we'll chase upstream on this, let's make this config
compatible with both frr versions.

Change-Id: Ia3922804fdffb49c06ef9b3497a52a9a8f1ccb64
Closes-Bug: #1939332

commit_message:
Use a dedicated version of get-pip.py for python 2.7

get-pip.py dropped python 2.7 support, so we cannot use the default
get-pip.py for python 2.7 now. get-pip.py for python 2.7 is available
at https://bootstrap.pypa.io/2.7/get-pip.py.
This commit tries to use python 2.7 version of get-pip.py
for python 2.7 environment.

Change-Id: I88ba370de8887a05c473fe7c19a61a319e8812d2
(cherry picked from commit 1382e933c5b2c16b276e8813fbc7cd9a1d6d4499)

commit_message:
Install python3-croniter for nrpe checks

Change ab79c3ee introduced the croniter library for interacting
with cron. However, the dependent package was not included in
a list of installation packages nor installed on the upgrade
path. This patch adds the python3-croniter package for upgrade
and installation paths to allow the nrpe checks to continue
to function.

Change-Id: I363f8e04a3850eecf219c5a26ab9137f217a0f36
Closes-Bug: #1928802

commit_message:
Fix naming of CentOS Stream in reno

commit_message:
Change cinder default branch to pike-eol tag

The Cinder project is going EOL on all stable/pike branches with
change If266ab3efa5bdde3642d13136363573208b1e4d6 and the branches
will soon be deleted.  Change the default branch for the cinder
deliverables from stable/pike to refs/tags/pike-eol.

Change-Id: I17b7f9af3d6bfa1d99589d3afe48d92209585739

commit_message:
[ceph-provisioner] Add ceph mon v2 port for ceph csi provisioner

This is to update ceph mon port from v1 to v2 for csi based rbd plugin.
also update cephcsi image to 3.4.0.

Change-Id: Ib6153730216dbd5a8d2f3f7b7dd0e88c7fd4389d
