[{'created': '2021-08-11 15:35:08.000000000', 'message': "Add devstack-enforce-scope job to enable the rbac scope checks

keystone has system scope feature implemented since
queens release. Now Devstack also started moving towards the new RBAC.

This commit adds a new job 'devstack-enforce-scope' which enable the
scope checks on service side and see if devstack setting are fine or not.

This job will be expanded to enable the scope checks for the other service
also once they start supporting the system scope.

This will help us to test the scope check setting.

Change-Id: Ie9cd9c7e7cd8fdf8c8930e59ae9d297f86eb9a95
"}]
commit_message:
Add devstack-enforce-scope job to enable the rbac scope checks

keystone has system scope feature implemented since
queens release. Now Devstack also started moving towards the new RBAC.

This commit adds a new job 'devstack-enforce-scope' which enable the
scope checks on service side and see if devstack setting are fine or not.

This job will be expanded to enable the scope checks for the other service
also once they start supporting the system scope.

This will help us to test the scope check setting.

Change-Id: Ie9cd9c7e7cd8fdf8c8930e59ae9d297f86eb9a95

commit_message:
Add Fedora 34 support

* update the support distro filter

* don't install xinetd which doesn't exist in F34 any more.  I think
  there is probably a bit more to do with swift ring-server but that
  can be a problem for another time.

* remove old F31 workaround

Change-Id:If2f74f146a166b9721540aaf3f1f9fce3030525c

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-10 04:53:46.000000000', 'message': 'install_pip: don't fail when not installed

On some platforms, "python -m pip" isn't available.  Currently this is
run undconditionally from the "get_versions" function; remove the call.

Change-Id: I91d6c66d055f02fa7b4368593b629933f82d8117
'}]
commit_message:
install_pip: don't fail when not installed

On some platforms, "python -m pip" isn't available.  Currently this is
run undconditionally from the "get_versions" function; remove the call.

Change-Id: I91d6c66d055f02fa7b4368593b629933f82d8117

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-10 04:53:46.000000000', 'message': "install_pip: Use packaged pip on Fedora

This uses the python3-pip package for Fedora but maintains the status
quo for existing distributions (i.e. for Suse we run get-pip.py but
don't uninstall, and for everything else we uninstall python3-pip and
run get-pip.py to be running the latest pip).

As noted inline, installing get-pip.py over Fedora 34's package no
longer works, and likely won't ever work again.  Unlike the LTS
distributions, the Fedora pip should be more up-to-date, so I think
it's best we just avoid any package overwrites.

Change-Id: I84129aadfcf585bb150a3daa39616246d3d84bbd
"}, {'created': '2021-08-11 05:01:19.000000000', 'message': "install_pip: Use packaged pip on Fedora

This uses the python3-pip package for Fedora but maintains the status
quo for existing distributions (i.e. for Suse we run get-pip.py but
don't uninstall, and for everything else we uninstall python3-pip and
run get-pip.py to be running the latest pip).

As noted inline, installing get-pip.py over Fedora 34's package no
longer works, and likely won't ever work again.  Unlike the LTS
distributions, the Fedora pip should be more up-to-date, so I think
it's best we just avoid any package overwrites.

Change-Id: I84129aadfcf585bb150a3daa39616246d3d84bbd
"}]
commit_message:
install_pip: Use packaged pip on Fedora

This uses the python3-pip package for Fedora but maintains the status
quo for existing distributions (i.e. for Suse we run get-pip.py but
don't uninstall, and for everything else we uninstall python3-pip and
run get-pip.py to be running the latest pip).

As noted inline, installing get-pip.py over Fedora 34's package no
longer works, and likely won't ever work again.  Unlike the LTS
distributions, the Fedora pip should be more up-to-date, so I think
it's best we just avoid any package overwrites.

Change-Id: I84129aadfcf585bb150a3daa39616246d3d84bbd

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-11 20:55:35.000000000', 'message': "Add Health Monitor support

TCP and UDP Connect health monitors are now supported by the
provider driver, when the underlying OVN version supports
them.

The health monitor uses the OVN distributed DHCP port as the
source IP for messages by default, if one doesn't exist then
a port will be created on each given subnet. The list of member
ports to monitor is updated whenever one is created or deleted.

Added support for SBDB notifications for Service Monitor
events generated when the OVN health monitor code detects
issues with connectivity. This will trigger updates to the
Octavia objects as members go on/offline so that the Octavia
API reflects the current running state of the load balancer.

Added a lot of new unit and functional tests to cover all the
new code, and enabled the tempest health monitor feature so
those tests are run as well.

(cherry-picked from ovn-octavia-provider commit 56eb4c8b0e266e820f4e0d9a00b4d02de78975e0)

Change-Id: I8138b31cc865aff48c434f4f537bdedb88e4a2f3

"}, {'created': '2021-06-14 21:28:34.000000000', 'message': "Add Health Monitor support

TCP and UDP Connect health monitors are now supported by the
provider driver, when the underlying OVN version supports
them.

The health monitor uses the OVN distributed DHCP port as the
source IP for messages by default, if one doesn't exist then
a port will be created on each given subnet. The list of member
ports to monitor is updated whenever one is created or deleted.

Added support for SBDB notifications for Service Monitor
events generated when the OVN health monitor code detects
issues with connectivity. This will trigger updates to the
Octavia objects as members go on/offline so that the Octavia
API reflects the current running state of the load balancer.

Added a lot of new unit and functional tests to cover all the
new code, and enabled the tempest health monitor feature so
those tests are run as well.

(cherry-picked from ovn-octavia-provider commit 56eb4c8b0e266e820f4e0d9a00b4d02de78975e0)

Change-Id: I8138b31cc865aff48c434f4f537bdedb88e4a2f3

commit_message:
Add Health Monitor support

TCP and UDP Connect health monitors are now supported by the
provider driver, when the underlying OVN version supports
them.

The health monitor uses the OVN DHCP port as the source IP
for messages, one must exist or the create or update
operation will fail.  The list of member ports to monitor is
updated whenever one is created or deleted.

Added support for SBDB notifications for Service Monitor
events generated when the OVN health monitor code detects
issues with connectivity. This will trigger updates to the
Octavia objects as members go on/offline so that the Octavia
API reflects the current running state of the load balancer.

Added a lot of new unit and functional tests to cover all the
new code, and enabled the tempest health monitor feature so
those tests are run as well.

(cherry-picked from ovn-octavia-provider commit 56eb4c8b0e266e820f4e0d9a00b4d02de78975e0)

commit_message:
Drop tenant_id templating from v2 endpoint

Manila's wallaby release [1] made it possible for
the v2 endpoint to not include a tenant_id
(project_id). This change was made to
accommodate interactions by system scoped users.

System scoped users cannot interact with an
endpoint that needs the "tenant_id" templating,
because system scoped tokens cannot be resolved
to a particular tenant_id by definition. More
information regarding this change is captured
in the release notes for the project [2] and
the API reference [3].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/manila/+/773709
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/manila/wallaby.html#prelude
[3] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/shared-file-system/#shared-file-systems-api

Change-Id: I77c81b79539ccedb7dbac3e30f6eb257b5f6e082
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit e790080e38c665511f0c3262c514f3edac2a1de1)

commit_message:
[Pure Storage] Resolve missing provider_id issue (PowerVC)

In PowerVC, cloning of multiple volumes fails due to the
provider_id not being populated correctly for a volume.

Change-Id: Ib08a0561aa404a7aee41b23ec5d30f9f52096687
Closes-Bug: #1938579

This follows other clustered services (like RabbitMQ) and

commit_message:
Set memcached server list from memcached_node_names

This follows other clustered services (like RabbitMQ) and
uses *_node_names (which contain FQDNs), instead of *_node_ips.

Certificate for Memcached TLS is also created using FQDN.
Because of this, validation failed when using pymemcache.
This patch fixes this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1929574
Change-Id: I9d0ddcc88098a5b891829192f1ce656842d0aa15
(cherry picked from commit 49921d57f5753dffe032b9501d1101707ce8cc1e)

commit_message:
Set memcached server list from memcached_node_names

This follows other clustered services (like RabbitMQ) and
uses *_node_names (which contain FQDNs), instead of *_node_ips.

Certificate for Memcached TLS is also created using FQDN.
Because of this, validation failed when using pymemcache.
This patch fixes this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1929574
Change-Id: I9d0ddcc88098a5b891829192f1ce656842d0aa15

Looks good to me.  Some more info for reviewers:
- Block Storage API v2 was removed from the current cinder master branch by https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/792299, so your devstack-based zuul jobs are already using cinder without v2
- python-cinderclient 8.0.0 doesn't support v2 and does not contain any cinderclient.v2 classes.  8.0.0 is currently in upper-constraints, so if you have any tests that use cinderclient, they are most likely using 8.0.0 at this point"}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2021-08-04 07:41:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Use Block Storage API v3 instead of API v2

Block Storage API v2 was deprecated during Pike cycle and is being
removed during Xena cycle, and current v3 API should be used instead.

Change-Id: Ia5247742b31f5f07186ef908588f0972d3ac609f

commit_message:
Ubuntu: Enforce utf8mb3 charset in MySQL

We are observing the failure in Ubuntu integration job caused by
broken idempotency. It seems current mysql/mariadb in Ubuntu replaces
utf8 with uft8mb3 automatically and this behavior results in unexpected
change in second run.
This change ensures that we use utf8mb3 in Ubuntu to avoid such
mismatch caused by internal translation.

Closes-Bug: #1929073
Change-Id: I9daa3cd628ecc699dca24f42ef07c665d93f5709

> I don't think this is the best approach, this should be done by tripleo-quickstart when we add tripleo-repo in the requirements, but I will not block it.

do you mean like there https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/791486/15/quickstart-extras-requirements.txt#13 ? If so I tried that but had issues with finding the ansible module after installation in that way.

> I would create a task to install the python3-requests using ansible module instead of shell script, just to keep it more "ansible"

could do that but I would still need the shell task for the python setup.py install etc

I know this is not ideal and I tried to get this working both with the git+ install as pointed to above, as well as installation via pip directly but in both cases I couldn't get the ansible module to be found.

I would like to merge this so we can start using the get hash for now with the plan to replace with a 'better' way. This could be to use a lookup instead of a plugin for the ansible module (apparently this makes it easier for discovery on all the nodes you want to run the ansible) and/or making the installation part of the tripleo-repos installation/setup.cfg.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2021-07-01 11:54:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Patch Set 10 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 30750, 'date': '2021-07-05 13:31:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2021-07-07 10:05:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

> Patch Set 14:

> are we missing tasks to install for container build and image jobs?

I think we're OK

For container build, we aren't really running those jobs any more far as i can see eg [1][2] didn't run for a while. I think besides content providers we only do explicit container builds with the tripleo-build-containers-ubi-8 job.

Neither the containers-ubi-8 job or the build image jobs use the repo-setup role (which is where we're wiring up tripleo-get-hash in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/791486

Instead they are directly using tripleo-repos [3][4] - so they should be unaffected by this change.





[1] https://zuul.openstack.org/builds?job_name=tripleo-build-containers-centos-8 
[2] https://zuul.openstack.org/builds?job_name=tripleo-build-containers-centos-8-ussuri

commit_message:
WIP: Install tripleo.repos in tqe plays undercloud/standalone

Used by https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/791486

The intent is to use this for now and work towards getting into
tripleo-repos rpm in the long run (and then removing this install).
The patch at [1] (merged) is a dependency of this patch as it
adds tripleo-repos to the required projects.

tripleo.repos.get_hash is installed from galaxy or git checkout.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/791908
Change-Id: Ib843f59f16ad30c07296a4328b3547396b94f71a
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-repos/+/801621

commit_message:
Add Create QoS operation to Network QoS Panel

Enabled Network QoS panel and added a button for
creating a new network qos policy with parameters
name(string), description(maxlen-255), and
shared(checkbox)

Partially-Implements: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/horizon/+spec/create-network-qos-policy

Change-Id: Ifabfac7553ddbb65fe387187da5dd2fafad31351

When failing to manage a share_snapshot, there is no need to commit the share snapshot quota usages. The right way is that skipping quota usages cuts when deleting or unmanging the share_snapshot with status of "error_manage". Also the size of error_manage share_snapshot should be set to 0.

commit_message:
Fix unmange share_snapshot with manage_error status will lead to quota error

When failing to manage a share_snapshot, there is no need to commit the share snapshot quota usages. The right way is that skipping quota usages cuts when deleting or unmanging the share_snapshot with status of "error_manage". Also the size of error_manage share_snapshot should be set to 0.

Change-Id: I2a115d189d97153ae1f7e425c0b6f1eb489a189e

[{'created': '2021-07-23 07:28:22.000000000', 'message': 'Improvements to federation packaging

While shibboleth and mod_auth_openidc can theoretically co installed
now, unfortunately the shibboleth enabled configuation will cause
issues when using mod_auth_openidc.
As we only drop the configuration for one of these apache mods at a time
I have decided that it is best we only support one of these packages
being present at any time to avoid conflicts.

Fix shibboleth compatibility for ubuntu 18.04

Package and module names were accidentally updated to equivalents
used for Debian and Ubuntu Focal+. This patch adds a temporary
vars file for Ubuntu 18.04 to maintain compatibility.

Change-Id: Ib0ebf1711db42dd00b3e14c1e5604fed2632437d
'}]
commit_message:
Improvements to federation packaging

While shibboleth and mod_auth_openidc can theoretically co installed
now, unfortunately the shibboleth enabled configuation will cause
issues when using mod_auth_openidc.
As we only drop the configuration for one of these apache mods at a time
I have decided that it is best we only support one of these packages
being present at any time to avoid conflicts.

Fix shibboleth compatibility for ubuntu 18.04

Package and module names were accidentally updated to equivalents
used for Debian and Ubuntu Focal+. This patch adds a temporary
vars file for Ubuntu 18.04 to maintain compatibility.

Change-Id: Ib0ebf1711db42dd00b3e14c1e5604fed2632437d

commit_message:
Include BIOS registry fields in bios setting list command

Add new params to the 'baremetal node bios setting list' command to
include support for the BIOS registry. The '--long' option will
retrieve and display the additonal BIOS registry fields, the '--fields'
option will retrieve and display selected fields. The header names
when the '--long' or '--fields' options are not used match the existing
functionality.

Note that the 'baremetal node bios setting show' includes these fields
by default with no changes.

Change-Id: I9d6d2e42879e12cce8e1f2111be1a27f1a251de2

commit_message:
Add configuration option for native prometheus exporter

HAProxy added native Prometheus support from v2.0. This can be
enabled using the existing stats endpoint via an additional
/metrics path.

commit_message:
openstack-macros: define _rpmmacrodir on CentOS 7

The _rpmmacrodir macro is only defined on CentOS 8 and later, so
the openstack-macro package fails to build on CentOS 7 unless we
manually define it in the spec.

Change-Id: I41755f057ab958573ba9fcb061eb4d5a321455cf

'}, {'created': '2021-08-04 07:59:17.000000000', 'message': "Update logic on allowed list

Due to the fact that the variable tempest_test_whitelist is often found
in the featureset and this one can't be ovewritten, in order to
workaround it, it's to allow the group and job be parsed (it was
mutually exclusive before) and set the precedence to job, but if the job
isn't found, use the group. So we can repalce the variable
tempest_test_whitelist on the featureset files without break the jobs.

Change-Id: I0677125c08ae1a7a43f22e10be6e0319afbec56a
"}, {'created': '2021-08-04 11:07:05.000000000', 'message': 'Update logic on allowed list

Allow both group and job to be parsed. The job will have precedence over
group, which means, if a job has a group configured, but in the
allowed_list.yml file have also that specific job with a specific set of
tests, the matching job will be choose instead of group. This will allow
us to configure the group for all jobs, without the need of too much
verbosing on the yaml file, as well as specify tests to be executed per
job.

An example:
All featureset 052 based job will run tempest minimum scenario tests,
however, we can set to scenario002 job run a completely different set of
tests.

Change-Id: I0677125c08ae1a7a43f22e10be6e0319afbec56a
'}, {'created': '2021-08-06 09:53:49.000000000', 'message': 'Update logic on allowed list

us to configure the group for all jobs, without the need of too much

job.

An example:
All featureset 052 based job will run tempest minimum scenario tests,
however, we can set to scenario002 job run a completely different set of
tests.

Change-Id: I0677125c08ae1a7a43f22e10be6e0319afbec56a
'}, {'created': '2021-08-06 16:01:22.000000000', 'message': 'Update logic on allowed list

allowed_list.yml file have also that specific job with a specific set of
tests, the matching job will be choose instead of group. This will allow
us to configure the group for all jobs, without the need of too much
verbosing on the yaml file, as well as specify tests to be executed per

An example:
All featureset 052 based job will run tempest minimum scenario tests,

Change-Id: I0677125c08ae1a7a43f22e10be6e0319afbec56a
'}, {'created': '2021-08-09 07:38:47.000000000', 'message': 'Update logic on allowed list

Allow both group and job to be parsed. The job will have precedence over
group, which means, if a job has a group configured, but in the
allowed_list.yml file have also that specific job with a specific set of
tests, the matching job will be choose instead of group. This will allow
us to configure the group for all jobs, without the need of too much
verbosing on the yaml file, as well as specify tests to be executed per
job.
Also, job is the only requried option, group can be optional, we will
always know the job name in zuul, but group might not be used.

An example:
All featureset 052 based job will run tempest minimum scenario tests,
however, we can set to scenario002 job run a completely different set of
tests.

Change-Id: I0677125c08ae1a7a43f22e10be6e0319afbec56a
'}]
commit_message:
Update logic on allowed list

Allow both group and job to be parsed. The job will have precedence over
group, which means, if a job has a group configured, but in the
allowed_list.yml file have also that specific job with a specific set of
tests, the matching job will be choose instead of group. This will allow
us to configure the group for all jobs, without the need of too much
verbosing on the yaml file, as well as specify tests to be executed per
job.
Also, job is the only requried option, group can be optional, we will
always know the job name in zuul, but group might not be used.

An example:
All featureset 052 based job will run tempest minimum scenario tests,
however, we can set to scenario002 job run a completely different set of
tests.

Change-Id: I0677125c08ae1a7a43f22e10be6e0319afbec56a

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-13 01:47:59.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of
dash-separated options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported
in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores.
Without this, we see 'UserWarning' messages
like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ica2651a3d83008e9637dedc20aa4a7d015ed76c3
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of
dash-separated options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported
in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores.
Without this, we see 'UserWarning' messages
like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ica2651a3d83008e9637dedc20aa4a7d015ed76c3

[{'created': '2021-07-23 20:04:40.000000000', 'message': "Release oslo.config for stable/ussuri

This release picks up new commits to oslo.config since
the last release from stable/ussuri.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 8.0.4..63213f8
63213f8 remove lower-constraints.txt
be3558b config-generator yaml format doesn't work with i18n fields
f1ab258 Updating lower-constraints.txt

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: I1bf1afac211cc95d1c0d0334cfcfcd1d6664f8f0
"}]
commit_message:
Release oslo.config for stable/ussuri

This release picks up new commits to oslo.config since
the last release from stable/ussuri.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 8.0.4..63213f8
63213f8 remove lower-constraints.txt
be3558b config-generator yaml format doesn't work with i18n fields
f1ab258 Updating lower-constraints.txt

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: I1bf1afac211cc95d1c0d0334cfcfcd1d6664f8f0

commit_message:
[zun-tempest-plugin] Tag train-last

Train branch is in Extended Maintenance now[1]. Tempest and
tempest plugins are branchless which means master version of
Tempest and its plugins is used to test the supported stable
branches.

Once any stable branch is moved to EM state then, Tempest and
its plugins compatible tag[2] needs to be released so that we can
keep testing the EM stable branches with that tag once master
Tempest and its plugins are not compatible[3].

Tagging 'train-last'[4] as well as a new version also with same hash.

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/train/index.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html
[3] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html
[4] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#extended-maintenance

Change-Id: Id71cc7d697dbdf53ed9252e463ce82182be7545b

commit_message:
Add distro/arch to requirements file path

This addresses an issue when upgrading between different operating
systems. In this case, the requirements files already exist for
the old OS, which prevents new wheels from being created for the
new OS. By using a different requirements path for each OS this is
avoided.

As part of this, repeated variable construction for the
requirements path is factored our into a vars file.

Change-Id: I881a40fee31df78bf96e451509671543a49520d9

Generic way to configure clean step priorites feature
( https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/744117 ) enabled support
for customising clean step priorities for any clean step by setting a
configuration option. However, due to an error in code, it was not possible
to use this feature to enable/disable steps entirely using this option
as overrides were applied too late, after the disabled steps were already
filtered out.

This change fixes this error, making it possible to use step priority
override configuration option to enable/disable steps as required.

commit_message:
Enable priority overrides to enable/disable steps

Generic way to configure clean step priorites feature
( https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/744117 ) enabled support
for customising clean step priorities for any clean step by setting a
configuration option. However, due to an error in code, it was not possible
to use this feature to enable/disable steps entirely using this option
as overrides were applied too late, after the disabled steps were already
filtered out.

This change fixes this error, making it possible to use step priority
override configuration option to enable/disable steps as required.

Story: 2009105
Change-Id: If3c01e6e4e8cedfe053e78fab9632bfff3682b06
(cherry picked from commit 71481ac483f0d1784cb10643da4c734abbea352f)

commit_message:
Add variables to set permissions for created files

When this role is used alongside the OSA repo server it is
important to be able to control file and directory permissions.
This patch adds variables to optionally set these when creating
requirements files and wheels.

Change-Id: I1131a7e9aa2345d4c07a88a2ad2c8a36e7a35d2b

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-23 15:37:46.000000000', 'message': 'Fix self-signed certs distribution

With multinode Octavia setup self and octavia_generate_certs is
True, role fails with distributing certificates.

While correct approach would be to replace that with PKI role, right now
we just patching current approach, by ensuring that facts are set
for octavia_cert_setup_host so we could reliable gain them.

Change-Id: I0dc2488b9e8e33847c9a2646032ac5f926d09133
Closes-Bug: #1936646
(cherry picked from commit 799f003b85a026c794d366caa4c6158a65b33423)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix self-signed certs distribution

With multinode Octavia setup self and octavia_generate_certs is
True, role fails with distributing certificates.

While correct approach would be to replace that with PKI role, right now
we just patching current approach, by ensuring that facts are set
for octavia_cert_setup_host so we could reliable gain them.

Change-Id: I0dc2488b9e8e33847c9a2646032ac5f926d09133
Closes-Bug: #1936646
(cherry picked from commit 799f003b85a026c794d366caa4c6158a65b33423)

commit_message:
Allow tuning of Galera gcache size

Appropriate gcache.size values allow a cluster node to perform IST
instead of SST if the writes occurred during its downtime do not exceed
the size of the cache itself.
This is especially beneficial during maintenance windows.

Closes-Bug: #1939540

Change-Id: I483484c58ab703f3a4dcede636d733e23b051f63
(cherry picked from commit feed67dcc45eb3da818cc2ceac8cb3682a2b6364)
(cherry picked from commit 1ce9d8855db0e282a4a0c47e9afdee3f7a102c39)

commit_message:
Deprecate os-panko role

Since upstream Panko project has retired, we deprecating role for it.

Since we might want to get some patches in for stable branches, we're
deprecating role instead of retiring it.

Change-Id: Iac98b8e09d1ee3f49c74800968e65a33547c6699

[{'created': '2021-01-14 06:16:03.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Remove py37"

This reverts commit e6b83e309dc5c71f98a3ba3d673c986afe98d9db.

Reason of revert:Python 3.7 *is* supported because it falls
in the range of supported Python versions (3.6-3.8) [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019648.html

Change-Id: I51353750976998b42db8c48328458fec12f99910
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Remove py37"

This reverts commit e6b83e309dc5c71f98a3ba3d673c986afe98d9db.

Reason of revert:Python 3.7 *is* supported because it falls
in the range of supported Python versions (3.6-3.8) [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019648.html

Change-Id: I51353750976998b42db8c48328458fec12f99910

subject: Create /etc/neutron/api-paste.ini
messages: [{'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2021-08-11 22:00:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-08-12 08:07:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2021-08-12 08:09:53.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nMaking the file available at the old location in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/804269 instead'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-11 22:00:11.000000000', 'message': "Create /etc/neutron/api-paste.ini

CentOS binary packages for Xena have moved Neutron's api-paste.ini file
to /etc/neutron [1]. In preparation for this change, link api-paste.ini
to its future location while we are still using Wallaby packages. This
will allow us to merge the configuration change in Kolla Ansible [2].

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/openstack/neutron-distgit/+/34845
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/804288

Change-Id: I563bec40ef9105f2391b26dce24ce4a22bd7921c
"}]
commit_message:
Create /etc/neutron/api-paste.ini

CentOS binary packages for Xena have moved Neutron's api-paste.ini file
to /etc/neutron [1]. In preparation for this change, link api-paste.ini
to its future location while we are still using Wallaby packages. This
will allow us to merge the configuration change in Kolla Ansible [2].

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/openstack/neutron-distgit/+/34845
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/804288

Change-Id: I563bec40ef9105f2391b26dce24ce4a22bd7921c

This patch adds "create_share" method under "BaseSharesAdminTest"
class. This wrapper allows us to check whether default share type
exists, if exists use it for share creation if not create a new
one.

This patch removes duplicated code by changing the inheritances.

commit_message:
If default share type exists, use it for share creation

This patch adds "create_share" method under "BaseSharesAdminTest"
class. This wrapper allows us to check whether default share type
exists, if exists use it for share creation if not create a new
one.

This patch removes duplicated code by changing the inheritances.

Change-Id: Ie88f8f6cbbe444968026f163c99649eab623c457

subject: container-server: distinguish between obj returned spi vs brokers
messages:
[{'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-08-11 07:12:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2021-08-11 12:57:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

I think this is a good idea, but wonder if we shouldn't return it all the time.

What was the thinking behind not always returning the new header, is it that it forces is to always test for its existence first if we ever use it, hence implicitly deal with older servers?"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2021-08-11 16:36:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Yeah, I'd like to see this rolled into the parent.

The "only include it if it's different" was my idea -- and yeah, the thought was to make use keep the upgrade path in mind more. Though of course, there's still the danger that you'll request one storage policy but then not check that the response came back indicating that the server actually knew how to check an arbitrary policy. *shrug* Either way.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2021-08-11 18:22:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-11 07:12:50.000000000', 'message': "container-server: distinguish between obj returned spi vs brokers

When returning a list of objects of a given spi that isn't the container
brokers default spi instead of changing the
X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index to reflect the requested spi use a new
header to represent the rewusted objects spi.

The X-Backend-Storage-Policy header should point to what the container
broker has set. So this patch adds a new response header
X-Backend-Record-Storage-Policy-Index which will match the spi of the
returned objects if it isn't the same as the broker spi.

This will hopefully avoid cache poisoning edgecases. And means we the
X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index will have a concrete meaning when we see
it.

Change-Id: Ifd768ddc719e2576bb539f3f7d1755aebd61a260

broker has set. So this patch adds a new response header
X-Backend-Record-Storage-Policy-Index which will match the spi of the
returned objects if it isn't the same as the broker spi.

This will hopefully avoid cache poisoning edgecases. And means we the
X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index will have a concrete meaning when we see

Change-Id: Ifd768ddc719e2576bb539f3f7d1755aebd61a260

When returning a list of objects of a given spi that isn't the container
brokers default spi instead of changing the
X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index to reflect the requested spi use a new
header to represent the rewusted objects spi.

The X-Backend-Storage-Policy header should point to what the container
broker has set. So this patch adds a new response header
X-Backend-Record-Storage-Policy-Index which will match the spi of the
returned objects if it isn't the same as the broker spi.

This will hopefully avoid cache poisoning edgecases. And means we the
X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index will have a concrete meaning when we see
it.

Change-Id: Ifd768ddc719e2576bb539f3f7d1755aebd61a260

commit_message:
container-server: distinguish between obj returned spi vs brokers

When returning a list of objects of a given spi that isn't the container
brokers default spi instead of changing the
X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index to reflect the requested spi use a new
header to represent the rewusted objects spi.

The X-Backend-Storage-Policy header should point to what the container
broker has set. So this patch adds a new response header
X-Backend-Record-Storage-Policy-Index which will match the spi of the
returned objects if it isn't the same as the broker spi.

This will hopefully avoid cache poisoning edgecases. And means we the
X-Backend-Storage-Policy-Index will have a concrete meaning when we see
it.

Change-Id: Ifd768ddc719e2576bb539f3f7d1755aebd61a260

subject: Regenerate octavia.conf
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-12 01:58:23.000000000', 'message': 'Regenerate octavia.conf

This change replaces the example octavia.conf file in octavia repo so
that the file includes more complete list parameters with corresponding
descriptions.
Also, description about allowed values are re-implemented using
the "choices" interface so that oslo-config-generator can render it
properly.

Change-Id: I36ab06d63e5a0a5a6e2ce59c37995a8e5fcfbf3d
'}]
commit_message:
Regenerate octavia.conf

This change replaces the example octavia.conf file in octavia repo so
that the file includes more complete list parameters with corresponding
descriptions.
Also, description about allowed values are re-implemented using
the "choices" interface so that oslo-config-generator can render it
properly.

Change-Id: I36ab06d63e5a0a5a6e2ce59c37995a8e5fcfbf3d

commit_message:
Convert all OS module imports to collections imports

Instead of importing code from 2.9 Ansible modules, start import
it from Openstack Ansible collection.
It requires Openstack Ansible collection to be installed and will
work with both Ansible 2.9 and 2.11

Change-Id: I0f9f0d26a6b499c13af994edd1353b19620be14d

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-02 11:33:32.000000000', 'message': 'Remove name parameter from cell export

Initially the idea was to have for each cell export information
for the additional cell to deploy. The name of the new cell
is provided to the export command to create the export file
name, if not specified via --output-file.
Since the exported information is not in all cases specific to
the new cell and can be shared with multiple cells, it does
not make sense to have the new cell name as a required parameter.
Lets remove the name parameter is it is right now that the
export information file name is generic to be used for multiple
cells.

Change-Id: If8b15fd206a32dbd5b2edb1cd500f4e2151313d9
'}]
commit_message:
Remove name parameter from cell export

Initially the idea was to have for each cell export information
for the additional cell to deploy. The name of the new cell
is provided to the export command to create the export file
name, if not specified via --output-file.
Since the exported information is not in all cases specific to
the new cell and can be shared with multiple cells, it does
not make sense to have the new cell name as a required parameter.
Lets remove the name parameter is it is right now that the
export information file name is generic to be used for multiple
cells.

Change-Id: If8b15fd206a32dbd5b2edb1cd500f4e2151313d9

> Patch Set 21: Code-Review+2
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> I don't like the new nested try..try in this version. But, we've been around too many times so I won't nit out on it. But I definitely liked the previous arrangement better. Was there some reason to change it?

Previously I was catching both forbidden and not found and raising Notfound only, in inner layer I just need to catch forbidden and Not found will be caught directly in the chain below.

If you have strong objection then I will revert it back to original."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-08-11 16:36:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-08-11 16:45:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

(1 comment)

> Previously I was catching both forbidden and not found and raising Notfound only, in inner layer I just need to catch forbidden and Not found will be caught directly in the chain below.
> 
> If you have strong objection then I will revert it back to original.

I just hate deep nesting and I think it makes it difficult to understand and lends itself to accidental bugs. I think it's much better to write the code (when possible) to avoid very deep nesting so that you can eye-parse and verify that all the hidden "else" or "no exception" cases are covered.

But no, you don't have to change it for me, it just seemed like a step in the wrong direction. We have other stuff to worry about, so no need to nit out on this.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-08-11 16:47:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

> 
> But no, you don't have to change it for me, it just seemed like a step in the wrong direction. We have other stuff to worry about, so no need to nit out on this.

Ack, Anyway I need to push a followup patch to reuse code in functional tests, I will correct this at that time, added to my ToDo list.'}, {'account_id': 8122, 'date': '2021-08-11 18:20:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 21:

This change also includes change in index method for 'GET' all
namespaces to not include properties, objects, tags, associations
etc. in the response if policies of either one is disabled.

The MetadefAPIPolicy object will raise Forbidden for cases where an
operation is forbidden, but the namespace would be otherwise visible to
the user, and NotFound otherwise to obscure the existence of namespaces
that the user can not otherwise see.

Partially implements: blueprint policy-refactor

Change-Id: I59cd3bbd98065457bf0c9cfaf6888b7f56f7617c

This change also includes change in index method for 'GET' all
namespaces to not include properties, objects, tags, associations
etc. in the response if policies of either one is disabled.

The MetadefAPIPolicy object will raise Forbidden for cases where an
operation is forbidden, but the namespace would be otherwise visible to
the user, and NotFound otherwise to obscure the existence of namespaces
that the user can not otherwise see.

Partially implements: blueprint policy-refactor

Change-Id: I59cd3bbd98065457bf0c9cfaf6888b7f56f7617c
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/grenade/+/803317
"}]
commit_message:
Move metadef namespace policy checks in the API

This change also includes change in index method for 'GET' all
namespaces to not include properties, objects, tags, associations
etc. in the response if policies of either one is disabled.

The MetadefAPIPolicy object will raise Forbidden for cases where an
operation is forbidden, but the namespace would be otherwise visible to
the user, and NotFound otherwise to obscure the existence of namespaces
that the user can not otherwise see.

Partially implements: blueprint policy-refactor

Change-Id: I59cd3bbd98065457bf0c9cfaf6888b7f56f7617c
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/grenade/+/803317

commit_message:
Allow opt-out of full ramdisk pruning

While aggressively pruning ramdisk contents reduces the size, it can
break packages that depend on any of the pruned directories existing.
Allow anyone impacted by that case to opt out.

Change-Id: I1b5a65a56d151a26ee44446c20c6df31bb695223

xenserver: recheck'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-06-13 05:56:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

heh, is devstack a test or not?  everything old is new again :)

I've just been around long enough to remember the "test-only" packages variable we had ... both when we started installing python deps [1] and decided it was default behaviour to do this [2].

TBH I think that people do non-production stuff in devstack that expects these to be here, and was how we ended up with this, so installing them is just part of the price of running devstack.  

Maybe, however, we have traded off too much towards convenience over speed by doing this, and we should do revert?

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/107001
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/167669'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2017-06-13 15:04:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

There are two related issues here. The first is that pip installation time just keeps getting longer and longer. Pip isn't quick, even when using wheels. This appears in part to be related to needing to evaluate all the inputs in order to do an install (existing packages, constraints, env markers, requirements, so on). General network and disk cost being the other significant slowdown here.

The second is that importing package resources lists and sorts all installed packages which directly affects the runtime of tools like openstackclient which devstack makes extensive use of. We end up with every additional python package installed slowing everything down.

Comparing the pip listing for gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ubuntu-xenial on this change and its parent the difference is 61 packages (or about 20% of total package count) so its not tiny."}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2017-06-13 15:10:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Also worth noting that test-requirements isn't necessary to run the services (see jobs passing below). They should only be necessary to run functional tests and unittests which run out of virtualenvs that explicitly install the test-requirements if they need them.

I think this is largely overkill for convenience. Happy to flip this around so that we keep this behavior by default then flip the bit in devstack-gate for job runs."}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2017-06-13 22:53:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-06-14 00:29:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> They should only be necessary to run functional tests and unittests 

I'd agree they *should*, and the straight devstack jobs are ok, but i wonder if all the plugin consumers realise this.  but, they're probably better of fixing whatever breaks, I would say"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-06-14 00:43:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

commit_message:
Add option to not install test-requirements.txt

The more software we install the longer it takes to run devstack and the
slower tools like OSC run. Avoid installing test-requirements to reduce
the total python package installation size.

Note that this currently defaults to not installing the test
requirements but rough plan would be to test it this way, update d-g to
set this var to False, then switch default to True in this change and
merge it. This way devstack itself is backward compatible but the test
runs by zuul should be sped up.

Depends-On: Ic5f1844ce732d447ee980b3c9fdc417f72482609
Change-Id: I2fd639b9005b3a23a1bc37b8424da8fc100c48f6

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-13 16:09:17.000000000', 'message': "Update default enabled services to handle OVN default

Neutron recently switched to using OVN by default in Devstack but didn't
update the default enabled services list in stackrc. This results in
errors like:

  [ERROR] /opt/devstack/lib/neutron_plugins/ovn_agent:360 The q-agt/neutron-agt service must be disabled with OVN.

We update the default enabled services here to address this.

Note that this was missed in CI because the CI job was modified to set
the enabled services. The CI jobs also set a few other env vars that we
may need to set by default in stackrc but one thing at a time.

Change-Id: Ifa41cc3e651e5afb76a468bdef705deb5f1d61ad
"}]
commit_message:
Update default enabled services to handle OVN default

Neutron recently switched to using OVN by default in Devstack but didn't
update the default enabled services list in stackrc. This results in
errors like:

  [ERROR] /opt/devstack/lib/neutron_plugins/ovn_agent:360 The q-agt/neutron-agt service must be disabled with OVN.

We update the default enabled services here to address this.

Note that this was missed in CI because the CI job was modified to set
the enabled services. The CI jobs also set a few other env vars that we
may need to set by default in stackrc but one thing at a time.

Change-Id: Ifa41cc3e651e5afb76a468bdef705deb5f1d61ad

commit_message:
Enable TLS path between Curator and Elasticsearch

Elasticsearch is TLS enabled.  Curator needs to be configured to use
cacert when communicating with Elasticsearch.

Change-Id: Ia78458516d6c8f975e478d85643dc4436b70b87c

commit_message:
Rename cinder plugin config option variable

Current naming in tempest based on type group and group info
for exeample : volume_feature_group and VolumeFeaturesGroup

In order to maintain more options for registarion we should be aligned
with tempest style .

we will have to extend registration to :volume_group and VolumeGroup
same as in tempest

Change-Id: I64722613acfe7620d3ae0fb29c1d3f85582bfe38

subject: Handle NodeLocked failures

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-11 13:43:02.000000000', 'message': 'Handle NodeLocked failures

Some actions can fail due to the node being locked as part of
normal operations. This was previously handled silently by
python-ironicclient, but when inspector was changed to use
openstacksdk, this was no longer handled.

Adds the retry wrapper around critical path methods involving
power/reboot ops and node updates which require locks.

Change-Id: I3d26cf46da02b3e8f3f773c0aeaed6843e0f26e5
Story: 2009107
Task: 42966
(cherry picked from commit 7f6c4c4378eff3d7fb7ae600faf17445dac0111d)
'}]
commit_message:
Handle NodeLocked failures

Some actions can fail due to the node being locked as part of
normal operations. This was previously handled silently by
python-ironicclient, but when inspector was changed to use
openstacksdk, this was no longer handled.

Adds the retry wrapper around critical path methods involving
power/reboot ops and node updates which require locks.

Change-Id: I3d26cf46da02b3e8f3f773c0aeaed6843e0f26e5
Story: 2009107
Task: 42966
(cherry picked from commit 7f6c4c4378eff3d7fb7ae600faf17445dac0111d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-09 13:16:40.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Fix Router Availability Zones for segmented networks

This patch changes the get_candidates_for_scheduling() method to also
consider all gateway chassis as potential candidates (limited by
Availability Zones) in case physnet parameter is empty (as for the
segmented networks case).

This patch is a simpler/backportable fix for the segmented networks +
Router AZs use case. In the future we should consider refactoring the
code responsible for scheduling the gateway router ports, a more
detailed
explanation of what is happening/needed can be found at LP #1939144.

(cherry picked from Neutron commit 8ac9e2fe6d37ba4608cf141c78017524a5cae1de)

Change-Id: I8dc5336c6e2acd0b0a2cad0e80eee91280b9f945
Closes-Bug: #1939144
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Fix Router Availability Zones for segmented networks

This patch changes the get_candidates_for_scheduling() method to also
consider all gateway chassis as potential candidates (limited by
Availability Zones) in case physnet parameter is empty (as for the
segmented networks case).

This patch is a simpler/backportable fix for the segmented networks +
Router AZs use case. In the future we should consider refactoring the
code responsible for scheduling the gateway router ports, a more
detailed
explanation of what is happening/needed can be found at LP #1939144.

(cherry picked from Neutron commit 8ac9e2fe6d37ba4608cf141c78017524a5cae1de)

Change-Id: I8dc5336c6e2acd0b0a2cad0e80eee91280b9f945
Closes-Bug: #1939144
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add missing bind argument to calls

Resolve the following RemovedIn20Warning warning:

  The ``bind`` argument for schema methods that invoke SQL against an
  engine or connection will be required in SQLAlchemy 2.0.

Change-Id: If9492a3842055dde3841eaeb72fb4c050563b6ac
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update helm repo url

The googleapi repo has been causing issues and the latest
one is giving an unauthorized error when trying to download
helm tarball.

This change moves the repo to use the official helm one.

Change-Id: I52607b0ca6d650d5f5e4a95045389970faa08cfb

commit_message:
Disable airship citylcoud nodepool provider

They are having trouble with Glance so we pause image uploads to that
cloud and set max-servers to 0.

Change-Id: If0233d22c9eb14720aaea17158d4ae9a7db32d6e

[{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-06-18 10:36:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-06-18 11:03:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

LGTM, I'm also personally hit by this running Fedora and while this has been rejected in the past I think it makes total sense today given our supported runtime is 3.8 for Xena."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-06-18 11:05:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yup, agreed. We can and should bump the versions when we change our supported runtimes."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-06-18 11:07:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-06-18 13:32:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/797054/1/iscsi : SUCCESS in 2h 54m 05s'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-06-18 16:08:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

is it failing on py3.9 in fedora ? but py3.9 unit and functional non voting jobs are passing here(they are on ubuntu focal though).

Only things is we add next py version targeting as non voting job in advance so that projects will fixing the things before that become the target version. If anything not working on Fedora py3.9 may be we can start fixing it?'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-06-25 10:16:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-06-25 10:18:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> is it failing on py3.9 in fedora ? but py3.9 unit and functional non voting jobs are passing here(they are on ubuntu focal though).
> 
> Only things is we add next py version targeting as non voting job in advance so that projects will fixing the things before that become the target version. If anything not working on Fedora py3.9 may be we can start fixing it?

It used to (due to eventlet issues, iirc). Perhaps this has been fixed since. However, we'll likely see the same issue raise its head again when Fedora introduces 3.10, then 3.11 after that, and so forth. Defaulting to testing against the upper limit of supported Python versions makes sense to me."}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-06-25 14:06:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded. For checking Nova with Ceph, add a comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Ceph Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/797054/1/iscsi : SUCCESS in 2h 52m 05s'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-06-25 17:23:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Hmm, looks like the gate job is failing because python3.6 isn't available, yet the 'openstack-tox-lower-constraints' job itself has the following stanza:

  bindep_profile: test py35 py36

da fuq?"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-07-22 12:12:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Workflow-1
> 
> Hmm, looks like the gate job is failing because python3.6 isn't available, yet the 'openstack-tox-lower-constraints' job itself has the following stanza:
> 
>   bindep_profile: test py35 py36
> 
> da fuq?

Ah, bindep profile isn't intended to install the underlying Python interpreter. This is instead handled by the base OS (or nodeset). openstack-tox defaults to ubuntu-focal, but we probably want ubuntu-bionic. I have pushed [1] to change that.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/+/801773"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-07-22 12:12:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-07-22 12:13:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Just stuck in the depends-on to prevent this merging before the openstack-zuul-jobs change lands (not that it can land before then anyway). I assume everyone is still happy with this idea so re-applying the +W'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-07-22 15:04:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded. For checking Nova with Ceph, add a comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Ceph Hyper-V CI

recheck'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-07-22 22:54:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/797054/2/iscsi : FAILURE in 2h 34m 46s'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-08-11 15:46:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck dependent patch has merged'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-08-11 17:32:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

can we please revert this.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-18 10:36:38.000000000', 'message': "tox: Encode specific Python versions

Declare specific versions of Python for environments that don't
specifically encode a version. We use the highest version officially
supported, Python 3.8, for most environments except lower-constraints,
which uses the lowest version, Python 3.6. This is necessary for users
on Fedora, where the default Python version is Python 3.9.

This will unfortunately introduce a small amount of busy work whenever
we change supported Python versions, as tox will need to be updated, but
that's a small price to pay for the usability wins that Fedora users
will see.

Change-Id: I240d5b8aa3eb1925b97af57e2644be61bfc106c2
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
tox: Encode specific Python versions

Declare specific versions of Python for environments that don't
specifically encode a version. We use the highest version officially
supported, Python 3.8, for most environments except lower-constraints,
which uses the lowest version, Python 3.6. This is necessary for users
on Fedora, where the default Python version is Python 3.9.

This will unfortunately introduce a small amount of busy work whenever
we change supported Python versions, as tox will need to be updated, but
that's a small price to pay for the usability wins that Fedora users
will see.

Change-Id: I240d5b8aa3eb1925b97af57e2644be61bfc106c2
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/+/801773

commit_message:
Run lower-constraints to ubuntu-bionic

The lower-constraints is supposed to test the oldest version of the
dependencies supposedly supported by a library or service. It doesn't
make sense to be running these on the newest version of Python supported
by OpenStack. Start running lower-constraints on ubuntu-bionic nodes
rather than ubuntu-focal. When we bump our minimum Python version to
e.g. 3.8, we can change this to ubuntu-focal (assuming anyone is still
working with lower-constraints by then).

Change-Id: Icaa4d8e03915d90b542b989ecb62a513125f2642
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Allow fmt package to be installed from epel repo

This is needed anywhere that ceph is used on centos-8

Change-Id: Ifcc3c903eb5c12d5ae0d9f553dfa0c4bdfef7f37
Closes-Bug: #1922699
